- Female with only one hind tibial spur that is large and curved (Fig. 72-2d); vertex strongly concave, as seen from front; hind basitarsus of male with hairy pocket near base of outer surface (Fig. 72-2c)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Haplomelitta of the Sambini:
- Female with two hind tibial spurs; vertex not or scarcely concave; hind basitarsus of male without hairy pocket (Fig. 72-2a, b)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Samba of the Sambini:
- Female with only one hind tibial spur that is large and curved (Fig. 72-2d); vertex strongly concave, as seen from front; hind basitarsus of male with hairy pocket near base of outer surface (Fig. 72-2c)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera H. (Haplosamba) of the Sambini:
- Mandible of female tridentate (male unknown)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera H. (Haplomelitta s. str.) of the Sambini:
- Mandible of female bidentate (inner tooth sometimes reduced to a shoulder)
- Propodeal triangle strongly differentiated, basal zone (and laterally entire length of triangle) with short longitudinal rugae; hind basitarsus of male strongly inﬂated (Fig. 72-2b), as broad as tibia
=====
Characteristics to the Genera H. (Atrosamba) of the Sambini:
- Mandible of female bidentate (inner tooth sometimes reduced to a shoulder)
- Propodeal triangle differentiated only by weak lines, without rugae on basal zone; hind basitarsus of male slender, much narrower than tibia
- Second submarginal cell about as long as ﬁrst; ﬁrst recurrent and ﬁrst submarginal crossvein usually well separated; basal vein meeting cu-v or nearly so; S7 of male with two pairs of pedunculate membranous lobes
=====
Characteristics to the Genera H. (Prosamba) of the Sambini:
- Mandible of female bidentate (inner tooth sometimes reduced to a shoulder)
- Propodeal triangle differentiated only by weak lines, without rugae on basal zone; hind basitarsus of male slender, much narrower than tibia
- Second submarginal cell distinctly shorter than ﬁrst; ﬁrst recurrent and ﬁrst submarginal crossvein close together, meeting one another or the former on either side of the latter; basal vein much basad of cu-v; S7 of male with one pair of pedunculate membranous lobes and one pair of hairy areas
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Meganomia of the Meganomiinae:
- Arolia absent (although long, hairy, yellow plantae project between the claws); ﬂagellum of male with apical segment or several segments curled and attenuate (Fig. 733c); hind basitarsus of male bent or contorted, or at least with curved carina on outer side
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Pseudophilanthus of the Meganomiinae:
- Arolia present, conspicuously black among associated pale interungual structures; ﬂagellum of male with apex simple or expanded as a plate; hind basitarsus of male simple
- Ocelli much in front of posterior edge of vertex, posterior ocellus separated from that edge by more than two ocellar diameters; upper part of head gently convex, as seen from front; front edge of median ocellus little if any nearer to posterior edge of vertex than to antennal bases; glossa as long as prementum or nearly so (Fig. 73-1b).
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Uromonia of the Meganomiinae:
- Arolia present, conspicuously black among associated pale interungual structures; ﬂagellum of male with apex simple or expanded as a plate; hind basitarsus of male simple
- Posterior ocellus separated from posterior edge of vertex by an ocellar diameter or a little more; upper part of head, as seen from front, feebly convex or ﬂat or with ocellar region slightly elevated; front edge of median ocellus much nearer to posterior edge of vertex than to antennal bases; glossa three-ﬁfths as long as prementum or shorter (Fig. 73-1a)
- Flagellum of male not expanded at apex (Fig. 73-3a); T4 and T5 (both sexes) without sublateral stridulating areas; basitibial plate of female not deﬁned (female un known in subgenus Nesomonia); glossa one-half to threeﬁfths as long as prementum
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Ceratomonia of the Meganomiinae:
- Arolia present, conspicuously black among associated pale interungual structures; ﬂagellum of male with apex simple or expanded as a plate; hind basitarsus of male simple
- Posterior ocellus separated from posterior edge of vertex by an ocellar diameter or a little more; upper part of head, as seen from front, feebly convex or ﬂat or with ocellar region slightly elevated; front edge of median ocellus much nearer to posterior edge of vertex than to antennal bases; glossa three-ﬁfths as long as prementum or shorter (Fig. 73-1a)
- Flagellum of male with apical segment expanded, platelike, black (Fig. 73-3d); T4 and T5 (both sexes) with sublateral stridulating areas hidden under preceding tergal margins; glossa less than one-third as long as prementum (Fig. 73-1a)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Dicromonia) of Pseudophilanthus:
- T7 of male biﬁd, without pygidial plate; galeal blade broad, shorter than stipes (Madagascar)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Pseudophilanthus s. str.) of Pseudophilanthus:
- T7 of male simple, with pygidial plate; galeal blade tapering, about as long as stipes (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera U. (Nesomonia) of Uromonia:
- Flagellum of male crenulate, 11-segmented; S8 of male with apical process narrower than disc of sternum (Madagascar)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera U. (Uromonia s. str.) of Uromonia:
- Flagellum of male not crenulate, 12-segmented (Fig. 73-3a); S8 of male tapering toward subtruncate apex, without recognizable apical process (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Macropis of the Melittinae:
- T wo submarginal cells (Fig. 68-1b); pygidial plate of male strongly developed; male with yellow face marks; gonostylus of male long, slender at least at base, articulated to gonocoxite; S8 of male not ending in beveled area suggestive of a pygidial plate (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Melitta of the Melittinae:
- Three submarginal cells (Fig. 68-1a); pygidial plate of male absent or weakly evident; male lacking yellow face marks; gonostylus of male broadly fused to gonocoxite (Fig. 74-2a, d); S8 of male ending in a beveled area suggestive of a pygidial plate
- Propodeal triangle dull (ﬁnely granular), large (width at upper margin usually at least nearly equal to distance between transmetanotal sutures); second submarginal cell usually wider than long or about as long as wide (Fig. 68-1a); S7 of male a large plate, truncate or emarginate apically, the lobes or processes reduced to small sclerotic structures and sometimes hair patches at posterior lateral angles of sternum (Fig. 74-2f) (holarctic, Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Redivivoides of the Melittinae:
- Three submarginal cells (Fig. 68-1a); pygidial plate of male absent or weakly evident; male lacking yellow face marks; gonostylus of male broadly fused to gonocoxite (Fig. 74-2a, d); S8 of male ending in a beveled area suggestive of a pygidial plate
- Propodeal triangle shiny (usually smooth), often ill-deﬁned, small (width at upper margin not over half distance between transmetanotal sutures and often much less); second submarginal cell usually longer than wide; S7 of male with a small disc, apex biﬁd or with membranous lobes or both (Fig. 74-2c)
- Scopa of female consisting of simple bristles; hind tibia and basitarsus of female slender, the latter three or more times as long as wide; anterior tarsus ordinary, with ordinary vestiture; S7 of male with apex weakly emarginate, bearing, at each side, a large, ﬂat, vertically expanded process with long erect hairs on outer surface (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Rediviva of the Melittinae:
- Three submarginal cells (Fig. 68-1a); pygidial plate of male absent or weakly evident; male lacking yellow face marks; gonostylus of male broadly fused to gonocoxite (Fig. 74-2a, d); S8 of male ending in a beveled area suggestive of a pygidial plate
- Propodeal triangle shiny (usually smooth), often ill-deﬁned, small (width at upper margin not over half distance between transmetanotal sutures and often much less); second submarginal cell usually longer than wide; S7 of male with a small disc, apex biﬁd or with membranous lobes or both (Fig. 74-2c)
- Scopa of female consisting of densely plumose understory beneath long simple bristles; hind tibia and basitarsus of female broad, the latter about twice as long as broad; anterior tarsus thickened or elongate, with dense, short vestiture; S7 of male with apex deeply biﬁd or with two long, slender apical processes, lobes at each side (if present) hairless (although spiculate), not ﬂattened, but coarsely striate or ribbed (Fig. 74-2c) (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Paramacropis) of Macropis:
- Vertex broad behind ocelli, ending in a sharp preoccipital carina; gonostylus of male slender, simple; S6 of male with broadly truncate apical process, S7 with apical process broader than body of sternum, process densely hairy (eastern palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Sinomacropis) of Macropis:
- Vertex declivous posteriorly, no carina separating it from concave occiput; gonostylus of male apically expanded and bilobed or biﬁd; S6 of male with attenuate apex, S7 with apical process narrow, pointed, bearing relatively sparse hairs
- Propodeal triangle punctate, hairy except for small median area (China)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Macropis s. str.) of Macropis:
- Vertex declivous posteriorly, no carina separating it from concave occiput; gonostylus of male apically expanded and bilobed or biﬁd; S6 of male with attenuate apex, S7 with apical process narrow, pointed, bearing relatively sparse hairs
- Propodeal triangle impunctate and hairless, smooth or rugose (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Paramacropis) of Macropis:
- Vertex broad behind ocelli, ending in a sharp preoccipital carina; gonostylus of male slender, simple; S6 of male with broadly truncate apical process, S7 with apical process broader than body of sternum, process densely hairy (eastern palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Sinomacropis) of Macropis:
- Vertex declivous posteriorly, no carina separating it from concave occiput; gonostylus of male apically expanded and bilobed or biﬁd; S6 of male with attenuate apex, S7 with apical process narrow, pointed, bearing relatively sparse hairs
- Propodeal triangle punctate, hairy except for small median area (China)
=====
Characteristics of the Subfamily Fideliinae, of the Megachilidae:
- Submarginal cells three (two in Pararhophites); mandible of female with preapical tooth (sometimes sufﬁciently enlarged that mandible is bilobed or biﬁd) or simple; dorsum of T6 of female hairless at least posteriorly, minutely roughened, often with a lateral ridge or carina suggesting that pygidial plate, if present, occupies most of exposed tergal surface; subantennal suture directed toward middle of lower margin of antennal socket, or usually so short that its direction cannot easily be determined
=====
Characteristics of the Subfamily Megachilinae, of the Megachilidae:
- Submarginal cells two; mandible of female with three or more teeth (except in Dioxyini and in a few Megachile that have a much elongated, bidentate mandible); dorsum of T6 of female usually with hairs, pygidial plate usually absent but, if present, then represented only by a narrow midapical process (Fig. 80-2); subantennal suture directed toward outer margin of antennal socket (Fig. 753)
=====
Characteristics of the Tribe Fideliini, of the Fideliinae:
- Submarginal cells three; stigma slender, parallel-sided, less than twice as long as prestigma, margin within marginal cell straight or concave (Fig. 76-1b); T7 of male strongly sclerotized with distinct pygidial plate, or with the plate drawn out into a long and sometimes deeply biﬁd process; episternal groove present above level of scrobal groove and curving posteriorly to form scrobal groove; body densely hairy, without yellow markings except sometimes on T6 of the female and on clypeus of both sexes (Africa, Chile)
=====
Characteristics of the Tribe Pararhophitini, of the Fideliinae:
- Submarginal cells two; stigma broad, about twice as long as prestigma, margin within marginal cell convex (Fig. 76-1a); T7 of male weakly sclerotized without distinct pygidial plate; episternal groove absent; body sparsely hairy, yellow or with yellow markings (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Neoﬁdelia of the Fideliini:
- Hind basitarsus of female slender, parallel-sided; hind legs of male enlarged, basitarsus forming two enormous curved talons; clypeus separated from antennal bases by much more than diameter of antennal socket (Chile)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Fidelia of the Fideliini:
- Hind basitarsus of female broadest near base, tapering to narrow apex; hind legs of male not enlarged or modiﬁed; clypeus separated from antennal bases by less than diameter of socket, subantennal suture thus difﬁcult to observe (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera F . (Fideliopsis) of Fidelia (modiﬁed from En-gel, 2002b):
- Mandible strongly bidentate, teeth long, slender, and diverging from one another; pygidial plate of male present; midapical process of male T7 with apex emarginate
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera F . (Fidelia s. str.) of Fidelia (modiﬁed from En-gel, 2002b):
- Mandible broadly bilobed (teeth broad and ﬂat), or with short, subapical tooth, or simple; male pygidial plate absent; midapical process of male T7 deeply bilobed (essentially forming two processes) or simple
- Marginal cell not extending beyond apex of submarginal cells, shorter than combined lengths of second and third submarginal cells; claws of female simple; front basitarsus of male ﬂattened and extended laterally as lamella (only a weak lamella in F. kobrowiBrauns)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera F . (Fideliana) of Fidelia (modiﬁed from En-gel, 2002b):
- Mandible broadly bilobed (teeth broad and ﬂat), or with short, subapical tooth, or simple; male pygidial plate absent; midapical process of male T7 deeply bilobed (essentially forming two processes) or simple
- Marginal cell extending beyond apex of submarginal cells, as long as or longer than combined lengths of second and third submarginal cells; claws of female biﬁd or cleft; male front tarsus unmodiﬁed, segments cylindrical
- Marginal cell about as long as combined lengths of second and third submarginal cells; apical ﬂagellar segment of male antenna hooked, preceding segments ventrally crenulate; female T6 off-white; male T7 deeply emarginate (essentially forming two apical processes)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera F . (Paraﬁdelia) of Fidelia (modiﬁed from En-gel, 2002b):
- Mandible broadly bilobed (teeth broad and ﬂat), or with short, subapical tooth, or simple; male pygidial plate absent; midapical process of male T7 deeply bilobed (essentially forming two processes) or simple
- Marginal cell extending beyond apex of submarginal cells, as long as or longer than combined lengths of second and third submarginal cells; claws of female biﬁd or cleft; male front tarsus unmodiﬁed, segments cylindrical
- Marginal cell longer than combined lengths of second and third submarginal cells; male antenna simple, unmodiﬁed; female T6 black; male T7 with single midapical process, apex undivided
=====
Characteristics of the Tribe Lithurgini, of the Megachilinae:
- Pygidial plate of male present (Fig. 80-4a, b), that of female represented by an apical process or spine (Fig. 802); metapleuron with lower half narrow (less than half as wide as upper end and ﬁve to six times as long as wide) to linear; outer surfaces of tibiae, except hind tibiae of some males, with coarse tubercles that do not end in bristles (Fig. 80-3b)
=====
Characteristics of the Tribe Dioxyini, of the Megachilinae:
- Metanotum with median spine or tubercle (except in Allodioxys and Ensliniana); mandible of female slender apically, bidentate, similar to that of male; pronotum (except in Prodioxys) with prominent obtuse or right-angular dorsolateral angle, below which a vertical ridge extends downward; sting and associated structures greatly reduced (scopa absent)
=====
Characteristics of the Tribe Megachilini (Sec. 84) — Arolia present; preaxilla, below posterolateral angle of scutum, vertical, smooth and shining or with some hairs, these much shorter than those of adjacent sclerites; body sometimes metallic green, blue, or brassy ...................... ............................................................ Osmiini, of the Megachilinae:
- Arolia absent, at least on hind legs, usually on all legs; preaxilla, below posterolateral angle of scutum, sloping and with small patch of hairs, these as long as those of adjacent sclerites; body nonmetallic or nearly so
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Trichothurgus of the Lithurgini(From Michener, 1983a):
- Labrum longer than clypeus, often much longer; hind tibia of female rather uniformly hairy on outer, anterior, and posterior surfaces, spicules relatively inconspicuous among the hairs; lower mandibular tooth longer than middle tooth, or, in some females, lower and middle teeth equal (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Microthurge of the Lithurgini(From Michener, 1983a):
- Labrum about as long as clypeus; hind tibia of female with hairs of broad, longitudinal outer zone shorter and sparser than those of anterior and posterior surfaces, spicules large and conspicuous in outer zone (Fig. 80-3b); lower mandibular tooth conspicuously shorter than middle tooth, which is the longest mandibular tooth (Fig. 803a)
- Body small, slender, hoplitiform; claws of female biﬁd (Fig. 80-3c); stigma of moderate size, broadest at base of vein r, sides converging toward base; maxillary palpi twosegmented (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Trichothurgus of the Lithurgini(From Michener, 1983a):
- Labrum longer than clypeus, often much longer; hind tibia of female rather uniformly hairy on outer, anterior, and posterior surfaces, spicules relatively inconspicuous among the hairs; lower mandibular tooth longer than middle tooth, or, in some females, lower and middle teeth equal (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Microthurge of the Lithurgini(From Michener, 1983a):
- Labrum about as long as clypeus; hind tibia of female with hairs of broad, longitudinal outer zone shorter and sparser than those of anterior and posterior surfaces, spicules large and conspicuous in outer zone (Fig. 80-3b); lower mandibular tooth conspicuously shorter than middle tooth, which is the longest mandibular tooth (Fig. 803a)
- Body small, slender, hoplitiform; claws of female biﬁd (Fig. 80-3c); stigma of moderate size, broadest at base of vein r, sides converging toward base; maxillary palpi twosegmented (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Noteriades of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Males)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- T7 weakly sclerotized, not exposed, hidden by large T6
- Scutellum with transverse preapical carina, behind which it is vertical or overhanging metanotum; clypeus with longitudinal carina continued dorsally between antennal sockets (Africa, southern Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Wainia of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Males)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- T7 weakly sclerotized, not exposed, hidden by large T6
- Scutellum not carinate, without such a posterior marginal zone; clypeus without longitudinal carina, or carina not continued dorsally between antennal sockets
- Scutellum curved down posteriorly, posterior part of its surface thus steeply sloping, vertical, or overhanging; metanotum well below level of most of scutellum; posterior lateral angle of scutum frequently acutely produced posteriorly (Africa and Israel to the Philippines)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Heriades of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Males)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- T7 weakly sclerotized, not exposed, hidden by large T6
- Scutellum not carinate, without such a posterior marginal zone; clypeus without longitudinal carina, or carina not continued dorsally between antennal sockets
- Scutellum ﬂat or scarcely convex, not curved down posteriorly and not overhanging metanotum; metanotum medially about on the level of most of scutellum; posterior lateral angle of scutum obtuse
- Posterior margins of S2 and S3 notched or stepped laterally; pronotal lobe without carinules in addition to carina (holarctic, Oriental, Africa, Central America)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Protosmia of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Males)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- T7 weakly sclerotized, not exposed, hidden by large T6
- Scutellum not carinate, without such a posterior marginal zone; clypeus without longitudinal carina, or carina not continued dorsally between antennal sockets
- Scutellum ﬂat or scarcely convex, not curved down posteriorly and not overhanging metanotum; metanotum medially about on the level of most of scutellum; posterior lateral angle of scutum obtuse
- Posterior margins of S2 and S3 not notched or stepped laterally; pronotal lobe with several minute carinules behind and parallel to carina, carina rarely absent but carinules present (except carinules absent in subgenus Dolichosmiafrom Burma) (holarctic, Burma)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Osmia (in part) of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Males)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- T7 strongly sclerotized, exposed though sometimes small
- Parapsidal line punctiform or rarely short-linear, oneﬁfth as long as tegula or usually less (Fig. 81-2a); S3 of male commonly emarginate with fringe in emargination, the middle of S3 being largely or wholly covered by an enlarged S2, and S4 neither emarginate nor fringed like S3 (but some have S2 and S3 transverse and similar to one another); body commonly with some greenish or bluish metallic color (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Afroheriades of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Posterolateral corner of scutum with marginal ridge not carinate, a dense patch of long pubescence on lateral surface (T6 with translucent apical lip extending beyond hairs and projecting at strong angle to surface of tergum) (South Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Ochreriades of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Posterolateral corner of scutum with strong marginal carina, pubescence absent lateral to carina
- Apical part of labrum without long, erect hairs; body slender, elongate (Fig. 81-6), scutal length at least equal to intertegular distance
- Pronotum elevated, scutum thus lacking anterior surface; body (at least metasoma) with yellow or ivory markings (Near East, Namibia)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Hofferia of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Posterolateral corner of scutum with strong marginal carina, pubescence absent lateral to carina
- Apical part of labrum without long, erect hairs; body slender, elongate (Fig. 81-6), scutal length at least equal to intertegular distance
- Pronotum medially not attaining level of dorsal scutal surface, anterior end of scutum thus bent down, forming anterior scutal surface; body without yellow or ivory markings
- Preoccipital carina complete, reaching hypostomal carina, where it is produced into strong tooth; S6 with acute median apical spine (Mediterranean region)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Noteriades of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Mesopleuron elongate ventrally, as long as scutum or nearly so; mesopleural signum narrowly linear; stigma relatively large, margin within marginal cell convex (as in Fig. 81-1c)
- Posterior edge of scutellum with premarginal carina, surface behind carina a narrow vertical or overhanging zone; clypeus with strong longitudinal carina (Africa, southern Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Pseudoheriades of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Mesopleuron elongate ventrally, as long as scutum or nearly so; mesopleural signum narrowly linear; stigma relatively large, margin within marginal cell convex (as in Fig. 81-1c)
- Posterior margin of scutellum not carinate, usually without vertical or overhanging marginal zone; clypeus without longitudinal carina
- Hypostomal area margined laterally by carina and fringe of long curled hair; acetabular interspace of mandible with short, oblique secondary ridge (Africa, India, Mediterranean region)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Stenoheriades of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Mesopleuron elongate ventrally, as long as scutum or nearly so; mesopleural signum narrowly linear; stigma relatively large, margin within marginal cell convex (as in Fig. 81-1c)
- Posterior margin of scutellum not carinate, usually without vertical or overhanging marginal zone; clypeus without longitudinal carina
- Hypostomal area not carinate or fringed laterally; acetabular interspace of mandible without secondary ridge
- Mouthparts long, in repose well exceeding proboscidial fossa [except in palearctic Stenoheriades asiaticus (Friese) and coelostoma (Benoist), which have medially emarginate clypeus and bidentate mandibles] (Africa, Mediterranean region)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Heriades of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Mesopleuron elongate ventrally, as long as scutum or nearly so; mesopleural signum narrowly linear; stigma relatively large, margin within marginal cell convex (as in Fig. 81-1c)
- Posterior margin of scutellum not carinate, usually without vertical or overhanging marginal zone; clypeus without longitudinal carina
- Hypostomal area not carinate or fringed laterally; acetabular interspace of mandible without secondary ridge
- Mouthparts short, in repose not or scarcely exceeding proboscidial fossa [palearctic species with clypeus not emarginate medially and mandible with at least three teeth] (holarctic, oriental, Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Protosmia of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Pronotal lobe carinate (holarctic, Burma)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Othinosmia (in part) of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Pronotal lobe usually not carinate (South Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Othinosmia (Afrosmia) of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Metapleuron with round dorsal projection; S1 with apical spine (East Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Hoplosmia of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Metapleuron planar, without round dorsal projection; S1 without apical spine (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Wainia(in part) of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Posterior lateral angle of scutum acute or right-angular, and produced posteriorly or in Wainia algoensis (Brauns) upward as strong lamella [except South African W. elizabethae(Friese), in which entire propodeum is densely shagreened] (Africa to Israel and east to the Philippines)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Osmia (Allosmia, some Erythrosmia) of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Metanotum with medial, dorsal spine, or clypeus rugose (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Hoplitis (most subgenera) of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Metanotum not spined medially; clypeus not rugose (holarctic, Africa, India)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Haetosmia of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- T6 with preapical carina visible through dense pubescence; mouthparts with hooked hairs; clypeus without longitudinal carina (Mediterranean region, East Africa to central Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Wainia (Wainiella) of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- T6 without preapical carina; mouthparts without hooked hairs; clypeus with longitudinal carina, carina sometimes obscured by dense pubescence (southern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Stenosmia of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Omaulus strongly carinate below nearly to midventral line; clypeus and mandibles obscured by dense plumose hair (Egypt to China)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Hoplitis (Kumobia) of the Osmiini of the EasternHemisphere (Females)(Based on Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Omaulus not carinate below; clypeus and mandibles with hair sparse, not obscuring surfaces (Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Heriades of the Osmiini of the WesternHemisphere:
- Propodeum with narrow horizontal basal zone, set off from declivous posterior surface by a carina, and divided by carinae into a series of large pits (Fig. 81-3); anterior surface of T1 broadly concave and delimited by strong carina; lines delimiting propodeal triangle absent or feeble (holarctic, Mesoamerica)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Osmia of the Osmiini of the WesternHemisphere:
- Propodeum without such a horizontal basal zone (but if pits and a zone set off by a carina are evident, then zone is usually sloping, and anterior surface of T1 is neither broadly concave nor delimited by strong carina); lines delimiting propodeal triangle distinct, at least as sharp changes in sculpturing
- Parapsidal lines punctiform (Fig. 81-2a) or at most three times as long as wide; body usually metallic (holarctic, Mesoamerica)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Chelostoma of the Osmiini of the WesternHemisphere:
- Propodeum without such a horizontal basal zone (but if pits and a zone set off by a carina are evident, then zone is usually sloping, and anterior surface of T1 is neither broadly concave nor delimited by strong carina); lines delimiting propodeal triangle distinct, at least as sharp changes in sculpturing
- Parapsidal lines linear (Fig. 81-2b); body rarely metallic although sometimes strongly so
- Thorax elongate (Fig. 81-6), a line tangent to anterior ends of tegulae is thus near middle of scutum, and ventral proﬁle of mesepisternum, in front of middle coxa, is as long as dorsoventral thickness of thorax (seen in lateral view); apex of marginal cell curving away from wing margin only at extreme apex (Fig. 81-1c); S6 of male fully exposed; labrum of female with few and inconspicuous erect setae, thus often appearing hairless (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Protosmia of the Osmiini of the WesternHemisphere:
- Propodeum without such a horizontal basal zone (but if pits and a zone set off by a carina are evident, then zone is usually sloping, and anterior surface of T1 is neither broadly concave nor delimited by strong carina); lines delimiting propodeal triangle distinct, at least as sharp changes in sculpturing
- Parapsidal lines linear (Fig. 81-2b); body rarely metallic although sometimes strongly so
- Thorax less elongate (Figs. 81-8, 81-10), a line tangent to anterior ends of tegulae is thus considerably anterior to middle of scutum, and ventral proﬁle of mesepisternum, in front of middle coxa, is much shorter than dorsoventral thickness of thorax; apex of marginal cell usually curving away from wing margin in apical oneeighth or more of cell; S6 of male usually concealed or only its apical margin exposed; labrum of female with numerous erect setae
- Posterior lobe of pronotum with several small vertical carinulae parallel to posterior margin; clypeus of female with apical, somewhat spatulate, slender horn (Fig. 8113); T6 of male with median apical rounded ﬂange and broad produced angle laterally (T7 of male not exposed) (palearctic; western North America)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Xeroheriades of the Osmiini of the WesternHemisphere:
- Propodeum without such a horizontal basal zone (but if pits and a zone set off by a carina are evident, then zone is usually sloping, and anterior surface of T1 is neither broadly concave nor delimited by strong carina); lines delimiting propodeal triangle distinct, at least as sharp changes in sculpturing
- Parapsidal lines linear (Fig. 81-2b); body rarely metallic although sometimes strongly so
- Thorax less elongate (Figs. 81-8, 81-10), a line tangent to anterior ends of tegulae is thus considerably anterior to middle of scutum, and ventral proﬁle of mesepisternum, in front of middle coxa, is much shorter than dorsoventral thickness of thorax; apex of marginal cell usually curving away from wing margin in apical oneeighth or more of cell; S6 of male usually concealed or only its apical margin exposed; labrum of female with numerous erect setae
- Posterior lobe of pronotum usually without carinulae [but with carinulae in Hoplitis (Alcidamea) pilosifrons (Cresson) and others]; clypeus of female without apical horn; T6 of male not as described above
- S1 of female with strong preapical bilobed process; S6 of female with median and apical spikes; posterior margins of T1 to T3 gently concave middorsally; S5 of male with deep midapical notch, its margin distally bearing a few capitate hairs (S6 of male without ﬂaps such as are found in Hoplitis, broadly exposed; S1 convex in proﬁle, its anterior surface not deﬁned) (California)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Ashmeadiella of the Osmiini of the WesternHemisphere:
- Propodeum without such a horizontal basal zone (but if pits and a zone set off by a carina are evident, then zone is usually sloping, and anterior surface of T1 is neither broadly concave nor delimited by strong carina); lines delimiting propodeal triangle distinct, at least as sharp changes in sculpturing
- Parapsidal lines linear (Fig. 81-2b); body rarely metallic although sometimes strongly so
- Thorax less elongate (Figs. 81-8, 81-10), a line tangent to anterior ends of tegulae is thus considerably anterior to middle of scutum, and ventral proﬁle of mesepisternum, in front of middle coxa, is much shorter than dorsoventral thickness of thorax; apex of marginal cell usually curving away from wing margin in apical oneeighth or more of cell; S6 of male usually concealed or only its apical margin exposed; labrum of female with numerous erect setae
- Posterior lobe of pronotum usually without carinulae [but with carinulae in Hoplitis (Alcidamea) pilosifrons (Cresson) and others]; clypeus of female without apical horn; T6 of male not as described above
- S1 of female without strong preapical process; S6 of female without spikes or rarely with midapical spike; posterior margins of T1 to T3 straight middorsally; S5 of male not deeply notched, without capitate hairs on margin
- S2 and S3 of male similar to one another; S5 and S6 of male hidden, largely membranous, only transverse apical marginal areas and lateral margins somewhat sclerotized, these sterna with large, basal, minutely hairy areas invaginated anteriorly into metasoma; distance from ﬁrst submarginal crossvein to ﬁrst recurrent usually twice distance from second recurrent vein to second submarginal crossvein (Fig. 81-1a); anterior surface of mesepisternum in front of omaulus smooth, shining, lower part usually sharply divided at omaulus from outer surface, lower part of omaulus carinate (except in subgenus Isosmia); male T6 with four strong teeth (Fig. 81-4) (except in subgenus Isosmia) (nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Isosmia) of Ashmeadiella:
- Omaulus not carinate; T6 of male not toothed
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Chilosima) of Ashmeadiella:
- Omaulus carinate below; T6 of male with four teeth (Fig. 81-4)
- Males
- Mandible tridentate
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Cubitognatha, Arogochila) of Ashmeadiella:
- Omaulus carinate below; T6 of male with four teeth (Fig. 81-4)
- Males
- Mandible bidentate
- Lateral margin of T6 distinctly and rather evenly convex, ending at nearly right-angular apex of lateral tooth
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Ashmeadiella s. str.) of Ashmeadiella:
- Omaulus carinate below; T6 of male with four teeth (Fig. 81-4)
- Females
- Outer side of mandible, as measured along lower carina, at most twice as long as scape [except in the group of A. (A.) cubiceps(Cresson)]; clypeus produced over base of labrum, clypeal apex usually truncate; well-developed pair of orange brushes beneath clypeal margin
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Ashmeadiella s. str.) of Ashmeadiella:
- Omaulus carinate below; T6 of male with four teeth (Fig. 81-4)
- Females
- Outer side of mandible, as measured along lower carina, at most twice as long as scape [except in the group of A. (A.) cubiceps(Cresson)]; clypeus produced over base of labrum, clypeal apex usually truncate; well-developed pair of orange brushes beneath clypeal margin
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Cubitognatha) of Ashmeadiella:
- Omaulus carinate below; T6 of male with four teeth (Fig. 81-4)
- Females
- Outer side of mandible, as measured along lower carina, more than twice as long as scape; clypeus produced or not over base of labrum, but if produced, then not simply truncate; orange brushes beneath clypeal margin reduced or absent
- Mandible bidentate, parallel-sided, elbowed; clypeal margin impunctate, upper margin protuberant
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Atoposmia s. str.) of Atoposmia:
- Proboscis in repose extending behind fore coxa; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus less than one-fourth as long as second
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Hexosmia) of Atoposmia:
- Proboscis in repose hardly reaching fore coxa; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus over one-half as long as second
- Body with weak greenish tints; T6 of the male without lateral tooth or angle, or rarely with obtuse angle
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Eremosmia) of Atoposmia:
- Proboscis in repose hardly reaching fore coxa; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus over one-half as long as second
- Body without greenish tints; T6 of male with lateral tooth or strong rounded angle
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Gyrodromella) of Chelostoma(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Third segment of labial palpus ﬂattened, its axis a continuation of that of second; T7 of male with dorsal pit
- Preoccipital carina present; propodeum with sloping basal zone little more than one-half as long as metanotum; T1 shallowly concave anteriorly (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Foveosmia) of Chelostoma(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Third segment of labial palpus ﬂattened, its axis a continuation of that of second; T7 of male with dorsal pit
- Preoccipital carina absent; propodeum with horizontal basal zone at least two-thirds as long as metanotum; T1 with anterior surface convex except for longitudinal groove
- Parapsidal line half as long as tegula or more; S2 of male without sloping platform, or, if present, then not carinate; labrum of female less than twice as long as broad (longer in C. isabellinum Warncke) (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Chelostoma s. str.) of Chelostoma(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Third segment of labial palpus ﬂattened, its axis a continuation of that of second; T7 of male with dorsal pit
- Preoccipital carina absent; propodeum with horizontal basal zone at least two-thirds as long as metanotum; T1 with anterior surface convex except for longitudinal groove
- Parapsidal line less than half as long as tegula; S2 of male with median prominence, its posterior surface a ﬂat sloping platform margined by carina; labrum of female elongate, nearly three times as long as broad or more (shorter inC. nasutum Pérez) (palearctic, introduced in nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Prochelostoma) of Chelostoma(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Third segment of labial palpus not ﬂattened, its axis directed laterally as in most megachilid bees; T7 of male without dorsal pit (male unknown in Ceraheriades)
- Hind coxa not carinate (North America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Ceraheriades) of Chelostoma(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Third segment of labial palpus not ﬂattened, its axis directed laterally as in most megachilid bees; T7 of male without dorsal pit (male unknown in Ceraheriades)
- Hind coxa with longitudinal carina along inner ventral margin
- T1 not concave on anterior surface; female mandible elongate, two-toothed; labrum apically thickened (central Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Eochelostoma) of Chelostoma(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Third segment of labial palpus not ﬂattened, its axis directed laterally as in most megachilid bees; T7 of male without dorsal pit (male unknown in Ceraheriades)
- Hind coxa with longitudinal carina along inner ventral margin
- T1 shallowly concave on anterior surface; female mandible not elongate, three-toothed; labrum not apically thickened (Himalayas to Thailand)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Rhopaloheriades) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 with strong midapical projection below strong rounded carina; S1 produced posteriorly as keeled projection completely covering median part of S2; last antennal segment expanded, wider than preceding segments (central Asia to Israel)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Neotrypetes) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 truncate or emarginate, transverse ridge, if present, apical; S1 produced as unkeeled projection not reaching apex of S2; last antennal segment not wider than other segments
- Mandible with two teeth, though upper one may be broad and truncate; gradulus of S4 procurved medially
- Apex of S6 acutely angled; S2 at most angulate laterally, not notched (North and Central America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Michenerella) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 truncate or emarginate, transverse ridge, if present, apical; S1 produced as unkeeled projection not reaching apex of S2; last antennal segment not wider than other segments
- Mandible with two teeth, though upper one may be broad and truncate; gradulus of S4 procurved medially
- Apex of S6 bilobate, truncate, or rounded; S2 distinctly notched laterally (Africa, oriental, palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Pachyheriades) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 truncate or emarginate, transverse ridge, if present, apical; S1 produced as unkeeled projection not reaching apex of S2; last antennal segment not wider than other segments
- Mandible with three teeth; gradulus of S4 straight, not procurved medially
- S2 without distinct fringe, at most with scattered hairs much shorter than hind basitarsal width; apical area of S2 transversely depressed below level of disc; basal zone of propodeum bounded posteriorly by a distinct carina that extends laterally behind spiracle; metanotum shallowly notched medially (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (T oxeriades) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 truncate or emarginate, transverse ridge, if present, apical; S1 produced as unkeeled projection not reaching apex of S2; last antennal segment not wider than other segments
- Mandible with three teeth; gradulus of S4 straight, not procurved medially
- S2 with strong fringe of hair at least as long as width of hind basitarsus; apical area of S2 not depressed below level of disc; basal zone of propodeum not bounded posteriorly by a carina, or carina extremely weak, no carina posterior to spiracle; metanotum not notched medially
- T6 with strong longitudinal crest abruptly terminated by a V-shaped, ﬂattened apical area; mandible and hypostoma clothed in dense pubescence obscuring integument (southern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Tyttheriades) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 truncate or emarginate, transverse ridge, if present, apical; S1 produced as unkeeled projection not reaching apex of S2; last antennal segment not wider than other segments
- Mandible with three teeth; gradulus of S4 straight, not procurved medially
- S2 with strong fringe of hair at least as long as width of hind basitarsus; apical area of S2 not depressed below level of disc; basal zone of propodeum not bounded posteriorly by a carina, or carina extremely weak, no carina posterior to spiracle; metanotum not notched medially
- T6 without longitudinal crest, contour not abruptly changed or ﬂattened near margin; mandible with sparse hair not concealing surface, but hypostoma with narrow longitudinal strip of short plumose hair obscuring integument, surface otherwise visible (southern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Amboheriades) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 not produced apically, without a brush of hair under margin; S2 not depressed basomedially, without hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 not reaching spiracle
- Frons and interantennal area with pair of juxtantennal carinae; T6 emarginate medially; T6 with Uor V-shaped raised area medially, without parallel-sided crest; S2 not notched laterally (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Heriades s. str.) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 not produced apically, without a brush of hair under margin; S2 not depressed basomedially, without hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 not reaching spiracle
- Frons and interantennal area without juxtantennal carinae; T6 not emarginate medially and/or T6 medially with parallel-sided longitudinal crest (palearctic, Africa, India)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Rhopaloheriades) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 with strong midapical projection below strong rounded carina; S1 produced posteriorly as keeled projection completely covering median part of S2; last antennal segment expanded, wider than preceding segments (central Asia to Israel)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Neotrypetes) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 truncate or emarginate, transverse ridge, if present, apical; S1 produced as unkeeled projection not reaching apex of S2; last antennal segment not wider than other segments
- Mandible with two teeth, though upper one may be broad and truncate; gradulus of S4 procurved medially
- Apex of S6 acutely angled; S2 at most angulate laterally, not notched (North and Central America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Michenerella) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 truncate or emarginate, transverse ridge, if present, apical; S1 produced as unkeeled projection not reaching apex of S2; last antennal segment not wider than other segments
- Mandible with two teeth, though upper one may be broad and truncate; gradulus of S4 procurved medially
- Apex of S6 bilobate, truncate, or rounded; S2 distinctly notched laterally (Africa, oriental, palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Pachyheriades) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 truncate or emarginate, transverse ridge, if present, apical; S1 produced as unkeeled projection not reaching apex of S2; last antennal segment not wider than other segments
- Mandible with three teeth; gradulus of S4 straight, not procurved medially
- S2 without distinct fringe, at most with scattered hairs much shorter than hind basitarsal width; apical area of S2 transversely depressed below level of disc; basal zone of propodeum bounded posteriorly by a distinct carina that extends laterally behind spiracle; metanotum shallowly notched medially (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (T oxeriades) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 truncate or emarginate, transverse ridge, if present, apical; S1 produced as unkeeled projection not reaching apex of S2; last antennal segment not wider than other segments
- Mandible with three teeth; gradulus of S4 straight, not procurved medially
- S2 with strong fringe of hair at least as long as width of hind basitarsus; apical area of S2 not depressed below level of disc; basal zone of propodeum not bounded posteriorly by a carina, or carina extremely weak, no carina posterior to spiracle; metanotum not notched medially
- T6 with strong longitudinal crest abruptly terminated by a V-shaped, ﬂattened apical area; mandible and hypostoma clothed in dense pubescence obscuring integument (southern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Tyttheriades) of Heriades (Males)(Modiﬁed from Griswold, 1985):
- S1 produced apically, with a brush of ﬁne hair under margin (except in Pachyheriades); S2 depressed basomedially, with a hump or ridge apicolaterally; lateral line of T1 reaching spiracle
- T6 truncate or emarginate, transverse ridge, if present, apical; S1 produced as unkeeled projection not reaching apex of S2; last antennal segment not wider than other segments
- Mandible with three teeth; gradulus of S4 straight, not procurved medially
- S2 with strong fringe of hair at least as long as width of hind basitarsus; apical area of S2 not depressed below level of disc; basal zone of propodeum not bounded posteriorly by a carina, or carina extremely weak, no carina posterior to spiracle; metanotum not notched medially
- T6 without longitudinal crest, contour not abruptly changed or ﬂattened near margin; mandible with sparse hair not concealing surface, but hypostoma with narrow longitudinal strip of short plumose hair obscuring integument, surface otherwise visible (southern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Annosmia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Thorax steeply declivous behind posterior part of scutellum; apical spines of fore and middle tibiae each simple (palearctic to Sudan)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Coloplitis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Labial palpus two-segmented, with abundant long, curled, capitate hair (Iran, Baluchistan)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Eurypariella) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Thorax slanting posteriorly to posterior part of basal area of propodeum, behind which propodeum is steeply declivous; apical spines of fore and middle tibiae robust, each biﬁd or with preapical shoulder (eastern palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplitis s. str.) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- S6 with submarginal carina, sometimes extremely weak and visible only laterally, so that females may not differ appreciably from those of H. (Annosmia) (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Bytinskia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Females
- Mandible four-toothed; either clypeus thickened and modiﬁed or scopa reduced, longest hairs shorter than exposed parts of sterna
- Clypeus neither thickened nor modiﬁed; scopa reduced, sternal hairs appressed, shorter than exposed parts of sterna (eastern Mediterranean; cleptoparasitic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Kumobia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Females
- Mandible four-toothed; either clypeus thickened and modiﬁed or scopa reduced, longest hairs shorter than exposed parts of sterna
- Clypeus thickened, modiﬁed; scopa not reduced, sternal hairs erect (central Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Kumobia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Females
- Mandible four-toothed; either clypeus thickened and modiﬁed or scopa reduced, longest hairs shorter than exposed parts of sterna
- Clypeus thickened, modiﬁed; scopa not reduced, sternal hairs erect (central Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Bytinskia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Females
- Mandible four-toothed; either clypeus thickened and modiﬁed or scopa reduced, longest hairs shorter than exposed parts of sterna
- Clypeus neither thickened nor modiﬁed; scopa reduced, sternal hairs appressed, shorter than exposed parts of sterna (eastern Mediterranean; cleptoparasitic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplitis s. str.) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- S6 with submarginal carina, sometimes extremely weak and visible only laterally, so that females may not differ appreciably from those of H. (Annosmia) (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Coloplitis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Labial palpus two-segmented, with abundant long, curled, capitate hair (Iran, Baluchistan)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Annosmia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Thorax steeply declivous behind posterior part of scutellum; apical spines of fore and middle tibiae each simple (palearctic to Sudan)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Eurypariella) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Thorax slanting posteriorly to posterior part of basal area of propodeum, behind which propodeum is steeply declivous; apical spines of fore and middle tibiae robust, each biﬁd or with preapical shoulder (eastern palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Megahoplitis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Apex of front basitarsus and second tarsal segment with strong, upcurved, capitate setae on outer surface; upper mandibular tooth truncate (Mediterranean region)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Formicapis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Mandible three-toothed (long, straight or undulate edge between middle and upper tooth); propodeum and anterior surface of T1 shagreened (northern holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthocopa) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Clypeal margin without notch, rarely with wide, angled emargination; hind tibial spurs slender, straight; fore basitarsus with plumose hair [but hair absent in H. (A.) furcula (Morawitz) and H. (A.) picicornis (Morawitz) and sparse and not evident in worn specimens of H. (A.) matheranensis (Michener)]; outer apex of middle tibia with narrow to broadly rounded lobe (palearctic, Africa, India)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Platosmia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Proboscis in repose not or scarcely extending beyond fossa; clypeus quite ﬂat, not convex above, somewhat ﬂared outward to broad truncation; suture between clypeus and supraclypeal area weak; body form robust, suggesting subgenus Anthocopa (northern Africa to T urkey)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Chlidoplitis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Clypeal margin with narrow, parallel-sided median notch; hind tibial spurs stout, strongly hooked apically; fore basitarsus with simple hair; outer apex of middle tibia with acute spine (T urkey)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Jaxartinula) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Mandible with long, slightly convex margin between second and uppermost teeth, thus possibly fourtoothed; median part of metanotum elevated and strongly convex, attaining level of scutellar convexity, so that line tangent to scutal and scutellar convexities is also tangent to metanotum, as seen in proﬁle (Central and northeastern Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Exanthocopa) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- T7 with shallow middorsal depression or pit; S6 without lateral ﬂaps; anterior surface of T1 with broad concave basin delimited above by transverse line and containing longitudinal median groove (northern Africa).
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Nasutosmia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Mandible four-toothed; propodeum and anterior surface of T1 shiny (Mediterranean region)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Microhoplitis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Hypostoma shiny, with sparse punctures and hairs, but without differentiated area behind mandibular base and without fringe demarcating this area; fore basitarsus without plumose hairs (Canary Islands)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Prionohoplitis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Preoccipital ridge carinate or sharply angled (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Megalosmia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- S2 bearing strong transverse ridge with rather sharp crest; wings with dark papillae beyond closed cells; body with abundant yellow hair forming broad, distinct metasomal tergal bands (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Monumetha) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Wings with weak papillae beyond closed cells, papillae not dark; metasoma with weak white hair bands interrupted medially (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Alcidamea) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Proboscis in repose extending at least a little beyond fossa; clypeus usually somewhat convex above, usually not ﬂared toward truncation [except in H. tridentata (Dufour and Perris), mitis (Nylander), etc.]; suture between clypeus and supraclypeal area usually distinct; body form slender (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Prionohoplitis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Preoccipital ridge carinate or sharply angled (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Microhoplitis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Hypostoma shiny, with sparse punctures and hairs, but without differentiated area behind mandibular base and without fringe demarcating this area; fore basitarsus without plumose hairs (Canary Islands)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Chlidoplitis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Clypeal margin with narrow, parallel-sided median notch; hind tibial spurs stout, strongly hooked apically; fore basitarsus with simple hair; outer apex of middle tibia with acute spine (T urkey)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthocopa) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Clypeal margin without notch, rarely with wide, angled emargination; hind tibial spurs slender, straight; fore basitarsus with plumose hair [but hair absent in H. (A.) furcula (Morawitz) and H. (A.) picicornis (Morawitz) and sparse and not evident in worn specimens of H. (A.) matheranensis (Michener)]; outer apex of middle tibia with narrow to broadly rounded lobe (palearctic, Africa, India)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Nasutosmia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Mandible four-toothed; propodeum and anterior surface of T1 shiny (Mediterranean region)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Formicapis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Mandible three-toothed (long, straight or undulate edge between middle and upper tooth); propodeum and anterior surface of T1 shagreened (northern holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Jaxartinula) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Mandible with long, slightly convex margin between second and uppermost teeth, thus possibly fourtoothed; median part of metanotum elevated and strongly convex, attaining level of scutellar convexity, so that line tangent to scutal and scutellar convexities is also tangent to metanotum, as seen in proﬁle (Central and northeastern Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Megalosmia) (in part) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Wings strongly stained, especially darkened in marginal cell; pubescence yellow; frons below anterior ocellus impunctate and polished (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Monumetha) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Wings with weak papillae beyond closed cells, papillae not dark; metasoma with weak white hair bands interrupted medially (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Pentadentosmia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Wings clear or only lightly stained; pubescence white or off-white; frons below anterior ocellus without impunctate polished area (palearctic south to Sudan)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Megalosmia) (in part) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Wings strongly stained, especially darkened in marginal cell; pubescence yellow; frons below anterior ocellus impunctate and polished (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Megahoplitis) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Apex of front basitarsus and second tarsal segment with strong, upcurved, capitate setae on outer surface; upper mandibular tooth truncate (Mediterranean region)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Platosmia) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Proboscis in repose not or scarcely extending beyond fossa; clypeus quite ﬂat, not convex above, somewhat ﬂared outward to broad truncation; suture between clypeus and supraclypeal area weak; body form robust, suggesting subgenus Anthocopa (northern Africa to T urkey)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Alcidamea) of Hoplitis of the EasternHemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1998):
- Base of labrum exposed between closed mandibles and lower margin of clypeus; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to lateral clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (mandible of female rather slender, distinctly narrower at or before middle than at base)
- Males
- Proboscis in repose extending at least a little beyond fossa; clypeus usually somewhat convex above, usually not ﬂared toward truncation [except in H. tridentata (Dufour and Perris), mitis (Nylander), etc.]; suture between clypeus and supraclypeal area usually distinct; body form slender (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Proteriades) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- S6 with longitudinal median hairy ridge, sometimes extending as median process beyond rest of sternum or consisting primarily of a midapical hairy process; T7 bilobed, sometimes only weakly so [except tridentate with lateral spine longer than median spine in H. (Proteriades) xerophila (Cockerell)]; metasoma commonly partly or wholly red, never metallic
- Galeal blade and ﬁrst two segments of labial palpus with numerous strong hairs that are hooked or wavy apically (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Acrosmia) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- S6 with longitudinal median hairy ridge, sometimes extending as median process beyond rest of sternum or consisting primarily of a midapical hairy process; T7 bilobed, sometimes only weakly so [except tridentate with lateral spine longer than median spine in H. (Proteriades) xerophila (Cockerell)]; metasoma commonly partly or wholly red, never metallic
- Galeal blade and labial palpus without hooked or wavy hairs (or, in Penteriades, with very few)
- Basal half of ﬂagellum with some hairs as long as ﬂagellar diameter; apex of last antennal segment produced laterally (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Penteriades) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- S6 with longitudinal median hairy ridge, sometimes extending as median process beyond rest of sternum or consisting primarily of a midapical hairy process; T7 bilobed, sometimes only weakly so [except tridentate with lateral spine longer than median spine in H. (Proteriades) xerophila (Cockerell)]; metasoma commonly partly or wholly red, never metallic
- Galeal blade and labial palpus without hooked or wavy hairs (or, in Penteriades, with very few)
- Flagellum with all hairs short; apex of last antennal segment unmodiﬁed or rarely tapering to a curved point
- Proboscis scarcely extending beyond proboscidial fossa in repose; hind coxa with longitudinal carina on inner ventral angle (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplitina) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- S6 with longitudinal median hairy ridge, sometimes extending as median process beyond rest of sternum or consisting primarily of a midapical hairy process; T7 bilobed, sometimes only weakly so [except tridentate with lateral spine longer than median spine in H. (Proteriades) xerophila (Cockerell)]; metasoma commonly partly or wholly red, never metallic
- Galeal blade and labial palpus without hooked or wavy hairs (or, in Penteriades, with very few)
- Flagellum with all hairs short; apex of last antennal segment unmodiﬁed or rarely tapering to a curved point
- Proboscis extending well beyond proboscidial fossa in repose; hind coxa without longitudinal carina (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Cyrtosmia) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- S6 without longitudinal median hairy ridge or midapical process (but with a tuft of hairs in Monumetha); T7 ending in a truncation, convexity, or point [tridentate with median spine longer than lateral spine in Cyrtosmia and H. (Dasyosmia) biscutellae (Cockerell)]; metasoma black or brownish black, sometimes metallic
- Mandible tridentate; T6 with median apical as well as lateral tooth; T7 tapering with three small adjacent teeth (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Formicapis) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- S6 without longitudinal median hairy ridge or midapical process (but with a tuft of hairs in Monumetha); T7 ending in a truncation, convexity, or point [tridentate with median spine longer than lateral spine in Cyrtosmia and H. (Dasyosmia) biscutellae (Cockerell)]; metasoma black or brownish black, sometimes metallic
- Mandible bidentate; T6 without median apical tooth except in Dasyosmia; T7 pointed, rounded, or truncate or, if tridentate (one species of Dasyosmia), then not tapering, teeth widely separated
- Metanotum approximately on same level as scutellum, a line tangent to scutum and scutellum in proﬁle thus nearly touching metanotum; stigma distinctly broader than prestigma, as measured to wing margin
- First recurrent vein nearly meeting ﬁrst submarginal crossvein; T7 four-lobed (northern holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplitis s. str.) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base; S1 to S5 not modiﬁed (introduced, New York State)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Monumetha) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- S8 elongate, distal process downcurved, ligulate, undersurface with short, modiﬁed hairs; S6 with midapical tuft of spreading hairs; antennal pedicel exposed [partly hidden in H. (M.) spoliata(Provancher)] (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Alcidamea) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- S8 without long, downcurved distal process, its hairs simple; S6 without tuft of spreading hairs; antennal pedicel largely hidden by invagination into apex of scape (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Penteriades) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
