- Galeal blade and ﬁrst two segments of labial palpus with numerous strong hairs, these hooked or wavy apically; proboscis short, in repose scarcely extending out of proboscidial fossa (T6 not strongly concave in proﬁle; posterior coxa with longitudinal carina on inner ventral angle; metasoma usually partly or wholly red)
- Maxillary palpus ﬁve-segmented; clypeus with upper two-thirds strongly swollen and shining, nearly impunctate medially (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Proteriades) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
- Galeal blade and ﬁrst two segments of labial palpus with numerous strong hairs, these hooked or wavy apically; proboscis short, in repose scarcely extending out of proboscidial fossa (T6 not strongly concave in proﬁle; posterior coxa with longitudinal carina on inner ventral angle; metasoma usually partly or wholly red)
- Maxillary palpus twoto four-segmented; clypeus uniformly convex, punctures moderately dense to crowded (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Robertsonella) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
- Galeal blade and labial palpus without hooked hairs; proboscis longer, in repose extending well beyond limit of proboscidial fossa (except in Acrosmia)
- Metanotum approximately on same level as scutellum, a line tangent to scutum and scutellum in proﬁle thus nearly touching metanotum; stigma distinctly broader than prestigma, as measured to wing margin
- Mandibular apical width nearly half of mandibular length; mandible tridentate; lower margin of clypeus entire; ﬁrst recurrent vein considerably distal to ﬁrst submarginal crossvein (eastern nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Formicapis) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
- Galeal blade and labial palpus without hooked hairs; proboscis longer, in repose extending well beyond limit of proboscidial fossa (except in Acrosmia)
- Metanotum approximately on same level as scutellum, a line tangent to scutum and scutellum in proﬁle thus nearly touching metanotum; stigma distinctly broader than prestigma, as measured to wing margin
- Mandibular apical margin more than half of mandibular length; mandible with two lower apical teeth followed by long undulate margin; lower margin of clypeus with median snoutlike projection; ﬁrst recurrent vein nearly meeting ﬁrst submarginal crossvein (northern holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Monumetha) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
- Galeal blade and labial palpus without hooked hairs; proboscis longer, in repose extending well beyond limit of proboscidial fossa (except in Acrosmia)
- Metanotum depressed below level of scutellum, which curves down posteriorly to meet metanotum, a line tangent to scutum and scutellum in proﬁle thus well above metanotum; stigma smaller, about as broad as prestigma, as measured to wing margin
- Mandible clearly four-toothed (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Cyrtosmia) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
- Galeal blade and labial palpus without hooked hairs; proboscis longer, in repose extending well beyond limit of proboscidial fossa (except in Acrosmia)
- Metanotum depressed below level of scutellum, which curves down posteriorly to meet metanotum, a line tangent to scutum and scutellum in proﬁle thus well above metanotum; stigma smaller, about as broad as prestigma, as measured to wing margin
- Mandible three-toothed, sometimes with a weak convexity between second and third teeth
- Median mandibular tooth almost twice as far from upper tooth as from lower tooth, with a weak convexity between median and upper teeth, the convexity sometimes worn so as to yield a long undulating margin above median tooth; S6 with longitudinal median ridge ending in apical tooth (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Acrosmia) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
- Galeal blade and labial palpus without hooked hairs; proboscis longer, in repose extending well beyond limit of proboscidial fossa (except in Acrosmia)
- Metanotum depressed below level of scutellum, which curves down posteriorly to meet metanotum, a line tangent to scutum and scutellum in proﬁle thus well above metanotum; stigma smaller, about as broad as prestigma, as measured to wing margin
- Mandible three-toothed, sometimes with a weak convexity between second and third teeth
- Median mandibular tooth more nearly midway between upper and lower teeth; S6 without median longitudinal ridge
- Proboscis short, in repose not extending beyond proboscidial fossa (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplitina) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
- Galeal blade and labial palpus without hooked hairs; proboscis longer, in repose extending well beyond limit of proboscidial fossa (except in Acrosmia)
- Metanotum depressed below level of scutellum, which curves down posteriorly to meet metanotum, a line tangent to scutum and scutellum in proﬁle thus well above metanotum; stigma smaller, about as broad as prestigma, as measured to wing margin
- Mandible three-toothed, sometimes with a weak convexity between second and third teeth
- Median mandibular tooth more nearly midway between upper and lower teeth; S6 without median longitudinal ridge
- Proboscis longer, in repose extending well beyond proboscidial fossa
- T6 nearly straight in proﬁle; metasoma partly red (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dasyosmia) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
- Galeal blade and labial palpus without hooked hairs; proboscis longer, in repose extending well beyond limit of proboscidial fossa (except in Acrosmia)
- Metanotum depressed below level of scutellum, which curves down posteriorly to meet metanotum, a line tangent to scutum and scutellum in proﬁle thus well above metanotum; stigma smaller, about as broad as prestigma, as measured to wing margin
- Mandible three-toothed, sometimes with a weak convexity between second and third teeth
- Median mandibular tooth more nearly midway between upper and lower teeth; S6 without median longitudinal ridge
- Proboscis longer, in repose extending well beyond proboscidial fossa
- T6 distinctly concave in proﬁle; metasoma without red
- Apex of mandible nearly as broad as eye; distal part of fore wing with minute papillae, median part with very few hairs (western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplitis s. str.) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
- Base of labrum exposed when mandibles are closed; lateral basal extremity of labrum connected to clypeal margin by yellowish membrane extending downward beside labral base (introduced, New York State)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Alcidamea) of Hoplitis of the WesternHemisphere (Females):
- Base of labrum hidden when mandibles are closed; lateral basal angles of labrum without yellowish membrane (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplosmia s. str.) of Hoplosmia (Males):
- Carina of T6 with numerous spines (Fig. 81-9b); T6 with distinct lateral tooth; T7 produced to median spine (Fig. 81-9b)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Paranthocopa) of Hoplosmia (Males):
- Carina of T6 simple, irregularly crenulate or nodulose (Fig. 81-9c); lateral tooth of T6 absent or very blunt; T7 not produced to spine
- T7 broad, subtruncate, much exserted, exposed part thus as long as T6
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Odontanthocopa) of Hoplosmia (Males):
- Carina of T6 simple, irregularly crenulate or nodulose (Fig. 81-9c); lateral tooth of T6 absent or very blunt; T7 not produced to spine
- T7 bidentate or bilobed with median apical emargination (Fig. 81-9c), or rounded, exposed part much shorter than T6
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplosmia s. str.) of Hoplosmia (Males):
- Carina of T6 simple, irregularly crenulate or nodulose (Fig. 81-9c); lateral tooth of T6 absent or very blunt; T7 not produced to spine
- Body clothed with off-white hair that does not obscure frons and scutum
- Preoccipital margin carinate dorsally; scopal hairs slender, crinkly, not blunted apically; hind basitarsus at least four times as long as broad
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Paranthocopa) of Hoplosmia (Males):
- Carina of T6 simple, irregularly crenulate or nodulose (Fig. 81-9c); lateral tooth of T6 absent or very blunt; T7 not produced to spine
- Body clothed with reddish hair that obscures frons and scutum
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Paranthocopa) of Hoplosmia (Males):
- Carina of T6 simple, irregularly crenulate or nodulose (Fig. 81-9c); lateral tooth of T6 absent or very blunt; T7 not produced to spine
- Body clothed with reddish hair that obscures frons and scutum
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplosmia s. str.) of Hoplosmia (Males):
- Carina of T6 simple, irregularly crenulate or nodulose (Fig. 81-9c); lateral tooth of T6 absent or very blunt; T7 not produced to spine
- Body clothed with off-white hair that does not obscure frons and scutum
- Preoccipital margin carinate dorsally; scopal hairs slender, crinkly, not blunted apically; hind basitarsus at least four times as long as broad
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Odontanthocopa) (in part) of Hoplosmia (Males):
- Carina of T6 simple, irregularly crenulate or nodulose (Fig. 81-9c); lateral tooth of T6 absent or very blunt; T7 not produced to spine
- Body clothed with off-white hair that does not obscure frons and scutum
- Preoccipital margin not carinate dorsally though rather abruptly angled; scopal hairs stout, smooth, blunted apically; hind basitarsus three times as long as broad
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Osmia s. str.) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Malar space with minimum length over half basal width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment; middle femur somewhat broadened basal to middle by rounded angle on undersurface; penis valves attaining apices of gonoforceps, which are slender and parallel-sided medially
- Proboscis of ordinary length, usually not reaching beyond middle of thorax in repose; anterior surface of T1 shagreened; antenna usually reaching propodeum and middle ﬂagellar segments usually over twice as long as broad
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Monosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Malar space with minimum length over half basal width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment; middle femur somewhat broadened basal to middle by rounded angle on undersurface; penis valves attaining apices of gonoforceps, which are slender and parallel-sided medially
- Proboscis extremely long, reaching metasoma in repose; anterior surface of T1 shiny; antenna not reaching propodeum, middle ﬂagellar segments less than twice as long as broad
- Front tibia with two apical spines, a shorter one posterior to usual single spine; metasomal terga with diffuse pale hairs but no fasciae; S2 large, nearly completely hiding S3, which is emarginate and fringed; T6 entire, T7 with feeble apical emargination
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Orientosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Malar space with minimum length over half basal width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment; middle femur somewhat broadened basal to middle by rounded angle on undersurface; penis valves attaining apices of gonoforceps, which are slender and parallel-sided medially
- Proboscis extremely long, reaching metasoma in repose; anterior surface of T1 shiny; antenna not reaching propodeum, middle ﬂagellar segments less than twice as long as broad
- Front tibia with usual single apical spine; metasomal terga with broad apical bands of dense white plumose hairs; S2 not enlarged, S3 fully exposed, not emarginate, with small, dense midapical fringe; T6 with small apical emargination, T7 entire
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Ozbekosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Malar space absent or linear, its minimum length half basal width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment or less; middle femur without rounded premedian angle on undersurface; penis valves not attaining apices of gonoforceps, or, if so, then gonoforceps usually robust and tapering throughout
- S4 with posterior margin not thin, with two apical carinae, at least laterally (the distal one being the sternal margin) and intervening narrow hairless groove along margin [often visible only in posterior view, and absent although margin rather thick in a few species such as O. (Pyrosmia) versicolor Latreille and ferruginea Latreille]
- T7 ending in long, slender, heavily sclerotized, blunttipped process; S2 and S3 similar to one another, both exposed, transverse, each with transverse shining gibbosity, that on S3 broken medially
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Helicosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Malar space absent or linear, its minimum length half basal width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment or less; middle femur without rounded premedian angle on undersurface; penis valves not attaining apices of gonoforceps, or, if so, then gonoforceps usually robust and tapering throughout
- S4 with posterior margin not thin, with two apical carinae, at least laterally (the distal one being the sternal margin) and intervening narrow hairless groove along margin [often visible only in posterior view, and absent although margin rather thick in a few species such as O. (Pyrosmia) versicolor Latreille and ferruginea Latreille]
- T7 relatively short, margin medially emarginate, two-, three-, or rarely four-toothed, rarely entire and rounded; S2 large, covering much of S3, which has fringed emargination, these sterna without gibbosities
- Margin of T6 medially projecting posteriorly or with median notch or crenulate; S5 simple, without velvety hair on disc or basal or lateral ridges; S6 without longitudinal groove, margin without projecting lobe
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Pyrosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Malar space absent or linear, its minimum length half basal width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment or less; middle femur without rounded premedian angle on undersurface; penis valves not attaining apices of gonoforceps, or, if so, then gonoforceps usually robust and tapering throughout
- S4 with posterior margin not thin, with two apical carinae, at least laterally (the distal one being the sternal margin) and intervening narrow hairless groove along margin [often visible only in posterior view, and absent although margin rather thick in a few species such as O. (Pyrosmia) versicolor Latreille and ferruginea Latreille]
- T7 relatively short, margin medially emarginate, two-, three-, or rarely four-toothed, rarely entire and rounded; S2 large, covering much of S3, which has fringed emargination, these sterna without gibbosities
- Margin of T6 medially gently convex, not crenulate or notched; S5 with velvety hair on disc or ridges; S6 with longitudinal groove, margin with projecting lobe
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Hemiosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Malar space absent or linear, its minimum length half basal width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment or less; middle femur without rounded premedian angle on undersurface; penis valves not attaining apices of gonoforceps, or, if so, then gonoforceps usually robust and tapering throughout
- S4 with posterior margin thin, without double carinae and groove
- Mandible three-toothed, middle tooth well separated from upper tooth by deep notch, upper tooth sometimes broad, truncate or even concave, so that mandible could be considered four-toothed
- T6 with strong posterolateral tooth; T7 not visible in dorsal view
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Neosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Malar space absent or linear, its minimum length half basal width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment or less; middle femur without rounded premedian angle on undersurface; penis valves not attaining apices of gonoforceps, or, if so, then gonoforceps usually robust and tapering throughout
- S4 with posterior margin thin, without double carinae and groove
- Mandible three-toothed, middle tooth well separated from upper tooth by deep notch, upper tooth sometimes broad, truncate or even concave, so that mandible could be considered four-toothed
- T6 without posterolateral tooth; T7 visible in dorsal view
- First ﬂagellar segment at least three times as long as broad; apical margin of S3 with hair-ﬁlled notch
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (T ergosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Malar space absent or linear, its minimum length half basal width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment or less; middle femur without rounded premedian angle on undersurface; penis valves not attaining apices of gonoforceps, or, if so, then gonoforceps usually robust and tapering throughout
- S4 with posterior margin thin, without double carinae and groove
- Mandible three-toothed, middle tooth well separated from upper tooth by deep notch, upper tooth sometimes broad, truncate or even concave, so that mandible could be considered four-toothed
- T6 without posterolateral tooth; T7 visible in dorsal view
- First ﬂagellar segment at most two times as long as broad; apical margin of S3, like S2 and S4, transverse, without hair-ﬁlled notch
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Allosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- T7 apically a simple process, much thickened and heavily sclerotized, ﬂattened on dorsal surface and margined almost like a pygidial plate; S2 with ﬂat-topped, bare longitudinal ridge apically almost to margin; maxillary palpus ﬁve-segmented
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Erythrosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- T7 biﬁd or bilobed, thin, not particularly heavily sclerotized, not ﬂattened on dorsal surface; S2 apically thin, rounded or feebly emarginate medially, hairy; maxillary palpus four-segmented or with minute apical ﬁfth segment
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Metallinella) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Anterior margin of metanotum sharp, elevated approximately to level of scutellar surface and with space between metanotal crest and posterior margin of scutellum; S2 with posterior margin transverse
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Melanosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Males):
- Anterior margin of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, which is curved down to metanotal margin; S2 with posterior margin broadly convex, sometimes with small median emargination
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Metallinella) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws cleft, inner ramus shorter than outer; anterior edge of metanotum sharp, elevated approximately to level of scutellar surface; space present between crest of metanotum and scutellum
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Osmia s. str.) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Head with small, usually bare and shiny depression immediately behind lower end of eye, i.e., below posterior margin of eye (body commonly covered with long, loose hairs rarely forming metasomal fasciae)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Helicosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Head without small depression immediately behind lower end of eye, although depression directly below or in front of lower end of eye, or occupying much of malar area, sometimes present
- Depression across mandibular base deep and abruptly set off almost vertically from adjacent ﬂat mandibular surface (Fig. 81-12d); orange hairs beneath clypeal margin arranged in four tufts, except when clypeus is highly modiﬁed, in which case there may be two broad tufts, or no orange hairs
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Monosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Head without small depression immediately behind lower end of eye, although depression directly below or in front of lower end of eye, or occupying much of malar area, sometimes present
- Depression across mandibular base absent or shallower, rarely completely separated from adjacent mandibular surface by vertical wall [some Melanosmia, e.g., O. nigriventris (Zetterstedt), approach the condition of Helicosmia]; orange hairs under clypeal margin in two tufts or brushes, or absent
- Malar space, where shortest, as long as width of pedicel; proboscis extremely long, reaching metasoma in repose
- Front tibia with two apical spines, a short one posterior to usual single spine; metasomal terga with diffuse pale hairs not forming fasciae
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Orientosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Head without small depression immediately behind lower end of eye, although depression directly below or in front of lower end of eye, or occupying much of malar area, sometimes present
- Depression across mandibular base absent or shallower, rarely completely separated from adjacent mandibular surface by vertical wall [some Melanosmia, e.g., O. nigriventris (Zetterstedt), approach the condition of Helicosmia]; orange hairs under clypeal margin in two tufts or brushes, or absent
- Malar space, where shortest, as long as width of pedicel; proboscis extremely long, reaching metasoma in repose
- Front tibia with single apical spine; metasomal terga with broad apical fasciae of dense, white plumose hairs.
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Allosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Head without small depression immediately behind lower end of eye, although depression directly below or in front of lower end of eye, or occupying much of malar area, sometimes present
- Depression across mandibular base absent or shallower, rarely completely separated from adjacent mandibular surface by vertical wall [some Melanosmia, e.g., O. nigriventris (Zetterstedt), approach the condition of Helicosmia]; orange hairs under clypeal margin in two tufts or brushes, or absent
- Malar space, where shortest, much shorter than width of pedicel; proboscis not reaching beyond middle of thorax in repose
- Hind coxa with strong longitudinal carina along inner margin and body nonmetallic, metasoma sometimes red; parapsidal lines usually short-linear, sometimes punctiform; erect tergal hair (middorsally on T2-T3, as seen in proﬁle, ignoring apical tergal margins) sometimes no longer than minimum width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment
- Maxillary palpus distinctly ﬁve-segmented
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Erythrosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Head without small depression immediately behind lower end of eye, although depression directly below or in front of lower end of eye, or occupying much of malar area, sometimes present
- Depression across mandibular base absent or shallower, rarely completely separated from adjacent mandibular surface by vertical wall [some Melanosmia, e.g., O. nigriventris (Zetterstedt), approach the condition of Helicosmia]; orange hairs under clypeal margin in two tufts or brushes, or absent
- Malar space, where shortest, much shorter than width of pedicel; proboscis not reaching beyond middle of thorax in repose
- Hind coxa with strong longitudinal carina along inner margin and body nonmetallic, metasoma sometimes red; parapsidal lines usually short-linear, sometimes punctiform; erect tergal hair (middorsally on T2-T3, as seen in proﬁle, ignoring apical tergal margins) sometimes no longer than minimum width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment
- Maxillary palpus four-segmented or with minute apical ﬁfth segment
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Neosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Head without small depression immediately behind lower end of eye, although depression directly below or in front of lower end of eye, or occupying much of malar area, sometimes present
- Depression across mandibular base absent or shallower, rarely completely separated from adjacent mandibular surface by vertical wall [some Melanosmia, e.g., O. nigriventris (Zetterstedt), approach the condition of Helicosmia]; orange hairs under clypeal margin in two tufts or brushes, or absent
- Malar space, where shortest, much shorter than width of pedicel; proboscis not reaching beyond middle of thorax in repose
- Hind coxa not or weakly carinate, or, if carinate, then body metallic, if with ridge in location of coxal carina (as in some Hemiosmia, Pyrosmia, T ergosmia,etc.), then ridge usually punctate, not raised and shining as in above; parapsidal lines punctiform or sometimes short-linear in T ergosmia;erect tergal hair much longer than minimum width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment
- First ﬂagellar segment nearly three to more than three times as long as wide
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Hemiosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Head without small depression immediately behind lower end of eye, although depression directly below or in front of lower end of eye, or occupying much of malar area, sometimes present
- Depression across mandibular base absent or shallower, rarely completely separated from adjacent mandibular surface by vertical wall [some Melanosmia, e.g., O. nigriventris (Zetterstedt), approach the condition of Helicosmia]; orange hairs under clypeal margin in two tufts or brushes, or absent
- Malar space, where shortest, much shorter than width of pedicel; proboscis not reaching beyond middle of thorax in repose
- Hind coxa not or weakly carinate, or, if carinate, then body metallic, if with ridge in location of coxal carina (as in some Hemiosmia, Pyrosmia, T ergosmia,etc.), then ridge usually punctate, not raised and shining as in above; parapsidal lines punctiform or sometimes short-linear in T ergosmia;erect tergal hair much longer than minimum width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment
- First ﬂagellar segment not over 2.5 times as long as wide
- Anterior trochanter with longitudinal ventral carina or sharp ridge that is most prominent medially so that lower edge of trochanter, in side view, is convex; mandible in ventrolateral view with strong submedian tooth on inner margin of lower edge (mandible four-toothed or approaching that condition because of distinct cutting edge forming tooth in upper interspace)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Pyrosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Hind coxa with longitudinal carina on inner ventral margin; clypeal margin usually with median impression (mandible usually three-toothed without cutting edge in upper interspace)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Melanosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Body frequently slightly to strongly metallic; pubescence often including black or fuscous hairs; mandible commonly four-toothed, usually because of cutting edge in upper interspace
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Ozbekosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Anterior margin of clypeus produced and rounded; impunctate hairless area behind mandibular base overhung by long, curved hairs
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (T ergosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Anterior margin of clypeus produced and truncate; impunctate area behind mandibular base limited and not extensively overhung by long hairs
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Metallinella) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws cleft, inner ramus shorter than outer; anterior edge of metanotum sharp, elevated approximately to level of scutellar surface; space present between crest of metanotum and scutellum
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Osmia s. str.) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Malar space as long as width of scape; small shining depression in genal area below and behind lowermost point of eye margin
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Helicosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Malar area shorter than width of scape, except in forms with anterior clypeal margin greatly swollen; no small shiny depression below eye
- Depression across mandibular base deep and abruptly set off almost vertically from adjacent ﬂat mandibular surface (Fig. 81-12d); orange hairs beneath clypeal margin arranged in four tufts, except when clypeus is highly modiﬁed, in which case there may be two broad tufts, or no orange hairs
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Monosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Malar area shorter than width of scape, except in forms with anterior clypeal margin greatly swollen; no small shiny depression below eye
- Males
- S2 transverse, posterior margin feebly concave, straight, to slightly convex; S3 not or weakly emarginate medially, exposed from side to side, posterior margin not or gently concave
- Front tibia with two apical spines, a short one posterior to usual single spine; metasomal terga with diffuse pale hairs not forming fasciae
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Orientosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Malar area shorter than width of scape, except in forms with anterior clypeal margin greatly swollen; no small shiny depression below eye
- Males
- S2 transverse, posterior margin feebly concave, straight, to slightly convex; S3 not or weakly emarginate medially, exposed from side to side, posterior margin not or gently concave
- Front tibia with single apical spine; metasomal terga with broad apical fasciae of dense, white plumose hairs.
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Allosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Malar area shorter than width of scape, except in forms with anterior clypeal margin greatly swollen; no small shiny depression below eye
- Males
- S2 large, posterior margin strongly convex; S3 medially hidden by S2, posterior margin broadly emarginate with fringe of long hairs in emargination
- Maxillary palpus distinctly ﬁve-segmented
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Erythrosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Malar area shorter than width of scape, except in forms with anterior clypeal margin greatly swollen; no small shiny depression below eye
- Males
- S2 large, posterior margin strongly convex; S3 medially hidden by S2, posterior margin broadly emarginate with fringe of long hairs in emargination
- Maxillary palpus four-segmented or with minute apical ﬁfth segment
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Neosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Malar area shorter than width of scape, except in forms with anterior clypeal margin greatly swollen; no small shiny depression below eye
- Males
- Malar space, where shortest, much shorter than width of pedicel; proboscis not reaching beyond middle of thorax in repose
- Hind coxa not or weakly carinate, or, if carinate, then body metallic, if with ridge in location of coxal carina (as in some Hemiosmia, Pyrosmia, T ergosmia,etc.), then ridge usually punctate, not raised and shining as in above; parapsidal lines punctiform or sometimes short-linear in T ergosmia;erect tergal hair much longer than minimum width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment
- First ﬂagellar segment nearly three to more than three times as long as wide
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Hemiosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Malar area shorter than width of scape, except in forms with anterior clypeal margin greatly swollen; no small shiny depression below eye
- Males
- Malar space, where shortest, much shorter than width of pedicel; proboscis not reaching beyond middle of thorax in repose
- Hind coxa not or weakly carinate, or, if carinate, then body metallic, if with ridge in location of coxal carina (as in some Hemiosmia, Pyrosmia, T ergosmia,etc.), then ridge usually punctate, not raised and shining as in above; parapsidal lines punctiform or sometimes short-linear in T ergosmia;erect tergal hair much longer than minimum width of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment
- First ﬂagellar segment not over 2.5 times as long as wide
- Anterior trochanter with longitudinal ventral carina or sharp ridge that is most prominent medially so that lower edge of trochanter, in side view, is convex; mandible in ventrolateral view with strong submedian tooth on inner margin of lower edge (mandible four-toothed or approaching that condition because of distinct cutting edge forming tooth in upper interspace)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Pyrosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Hind coxa with longitudinal carina on inner ventral margin; clypeal margin usually with median impression (mandible usually three-toothed without cutting edge in upper interspace)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Melanosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Body frequently slightly to strongly metallic; pubescence often including black or fuscous hairs; mandible commonly four-toothed, usually because of cutting edge in upper interspace
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Ozbekosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Anterior margin of clypeus produced and rounded; impunctate hairless area behind mandibular base overhung by long, curved hairs
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Osmia s. str.) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Malar space as long as width of scape; small shining depression in genal area below and behind lowermost point of eye margin
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O.(Mystacosmia) of Osmia of the Eastern Hemi-sphere (Females):
- Claws simple; anterior edge of metanotum below level of most of scutellum, i.e., scutellar surface curved down to margin of metanotum [except in long-bodied species ofPyrosmia (e.g., O. cephalotes Morawitz) in which metanotum is horizontal, on level with scutellum]; ordinarily no space between edge of metanotum and scutellum
- Malar area shorter than width of scape, except in forms with anterior clypeal margin greatly swollen; no small shiny depression below eye
- Males
- Malar space, where shortest, much shorter than width of pedicel; proboscis not reaching beyond middle of thorax in repose
- Median ﬂagellar segments 1.5 times as long as broad; T6 prolonged medially over T7
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Othinosmia s. str.) of Othinosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- Front tibia with apical spine long, curved posteriorly; S2 not depressed medially, without dense covering of hair; hypostomal area with polished, impunctate area (southern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Afrosmia) of Othinosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- Front tibia with apical spine short, straight; S2 depressed medially, densely covered with velvety hair; hypostomal area without polished, impunctate area
- Metapleuron with large dorsal projection; axilla produced to acute angle (Kenya)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Megaloheriades) of Othinosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- Front tibia with apical spine short, straight; S2 depressed medially, densely covered with velvety hair; hypostomal area without polished, impunctate area
- Metapleuron without dorsal projection; axilla rounded (southern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Othinosmia s. str.) of Othinosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- Front tibia with apical spine long, curved posteriorly; S2 not depressed medially, without dense covering of hair; hypostomal area with polished, impunctate area (southern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Afrosmia) of Othinosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- Front tibia with apical spine short, straight; S2 depressed medially, densely covered with velvety hair; hypostomal area without polished, impunctate area
- Metapleuron with large dorsal projection; axilla produced to acute angle (Kenya)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera O. (Megaloheriades) of Othinosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- Front tibia with apical spine short, straight; S2 depressed medially, densely covered with velvety hair; hypostomal area without polished, impunctate area
- Metapleuron without dorsal projection; axilla rounded (southern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Protosmia s. str.) of Protosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- S1 with large ventral projection; margin of T6 acutely angled laterally; ﬂagellum modiﬁed
- Gena with elongate lateroventral fovea or crease; distal ﬂagellar segments stout (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Dolichosmia) of Protosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- S1 with large ventral projection; margin of T6 acutely angled laterally; ﬂagellum modiﬁed
- Gena without lateroventral fovea; distal ﬂagellar segments, except the last, threadlike (Burma)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Chelostomopsis) of Protosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- S1 without ventral projection; margin of T6 not acutely angled laterally; ﬂagellum not modiﬁed
- T6 in dorsal view with strongly projecting median lobe; pronotal lobe not carinate; S2 with median longitudinal line of short, appressed hairs, these quite different from long, erect hairs of adjacent areas (Mediterranean region, western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Nanosmia) of Protosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- S1 without ventral projection; margin of T6 not acutely angled laterally; ﬂagellum not modiﬁed
- T6 in dorsal view with weakly projecting median lobe; pronotal lobe carinate; S2 without median longitudinal line of short hairs (Mediterranean region)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Protosmia s. str.) of Protosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- S1 with large ventral projection; margin of T6 acutely angled laterally; ﬂagellum modiﬁed
- Gena with elongate lateroventral fovea or crease; distal ﬂagellar segments stout (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Dolichosmia) of Protosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- S1 with large ventral projection; margin of T6 acutely angled laterally; ﬂagellum modiﬁed
- Gena without lateroventral fovea; distal ﬂagellar segments, except the last, threadlike (Burma)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Chelostomopsis) of Protosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- S1 without ventral projection; margin of T6 not acutely angled laterally; ﬂagellum not modiﬁed
- T6 in dorsal view with strongly projecting median lobe; pronotal lobe not carinate; S2 with median longitudinal line of short, appressed hairs, these quite different from long, erect hairs of adjacent areas (Mediterranean region, western nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Nanosmia of Protosmia (Males)(By T erry L. Griswold):
- S1 without ventral projection; margin of T6 not acutely angled laterally; ﬂagellum not modiﬁed
- T6 in dorsal view with weakly projecting median lobe; pronotal lobe carinate; S2 without median longitudinal line of short hairs (Mediterranean region)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera W . (Wainia s. str.) of Wainia:
- Metasomal pale hair bands of T2 to T4, except laterally on basal terga, immediately behind graduli, not on posterior marginal zones of terga; mandible of male threetoothed (Africa to southern India and the Philippines)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera W . (Wainiella) of Wainia:
- Metasomal pale hair bands on posterior marginal zones of terga; mandible of male two-toothed
- Body heriadiform, 6-8 mm long; omaular carina distinct; female clypeus with longitudinal median carina; tibial spurs strongly hooked; labrum of female without well-formed fringe (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera Caposmia of Wainia:
- Metasomal pale hair bands on posterior marginal zones of terga; mandible of male two-toothed
- Body robust hoplitiform, 8.0-10.5 mm long; omaular carina absent; female without clypeal carina; tibial spurs weakly curved at apices; labrum of female with distinct fringe (southern Africa and Israel)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Anthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- T5 with posterior marginal zone depressed (except sometimes medially), more ﬁnely punctate than rest of tergum and usually densely so, not over half as wide laterally as medially, this zone ending in very narrow, smooth posterior margin, the anterior margin of depressed zone often obtusely angulate medially, whole zone thus very broadly triangular
- T6 of female with margin usually not denticulate, sometimes with lateral tooth, with median apical notch or emargination accommodating sting [margin rarely denticulate, e.g., A. (Proanthidium) oblongatum Latreille]; T5 of female with basal edge of depressed marginal zone commonly obtusely angulate medially, zone thus broadly triangular; penis valves of male widely separated basally, united by long, narrow bridge; volsella projecting as lobe at apex of gonocoxite
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Afranthidium (in part) of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- T5 with posterior marginal zone either not depressed or weakly to strongly depressed, but if recognizable, then punctate like rest of tergum to impunctate, often over half as wide laterally as medially, this zone often ending in broad, smooth posterior margin, the anterior margin of depressed zone straight or curved, not angulate, or with small basal median angular projection
- First recurrent vein entering second submarginal cell; axillar margin rounded or straight; face without longitudinal median ridge
- Basal area of propodeum with hairs, sometimes very short; pale markings usually present, but if not [as in Gnathanthidium and Afranthidium (Immanthidium), etc.], then scutellum usually angulate laterally and terga with impunctate marginal zones
- Preoccipital ridge and omaulus rounded or at most carinate (except preoccipital ridge lamellate inGnathanthidium)
- Subantennal suture straight or weakly arcuate; S4 and S5 of male not strongly concave, rather simple, S3 to S5 without combs or areas of specialized bristles, posterior margins straight or weakly concave (with lateral projections in Neanthidium and on S5 in Gnathanthidium)
- T6 of male simple, T7 short, bidentate, bilobed, or tridentate; S4 and S5 without lateral projections or (in Gnathanthidium) S5 with such projections; T6 of female without or with very weak lateral spine and median emargination
- Mandible of female with eight teeth or less; scutellum rounded as seen from above, sometimes weakly emarginate medially, not or incompletely carinate; tibiae tuberculate or not (Africa, palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Serapista of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- T5 with posterior marginal zone either not depressed or weakly to strongly depressed, but if recognizable, then punctate like rest of tergum to impunctate, often over half as wide laterally as medially, this zone often ending in broad, smooth posterior margin, the anterior margin of depressed zone straight or curved, not angulate, or with small basal median angular projection
- First recurrent vein joining ﬁrst submarginal cell; axilla acutely pointed; face with shiny longitudinal median ridge from frons to clypeus (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Anthidioma of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- T5 with posterior marginal zone either not depressed or weakly to strongly depressed, but if recognizable, then punctate like rest of tergum to impunctate, often over half as wide laterally as medially, this zone often ending in broad, smooth posterior margin, the anterior margin of depressed zone straight or curved, not angulate, or with small basal median angular projection
- First recurrent vein entering second submarginal cell; axillar margin rounded or straight; face without longitudinal median ridge
- Basal area of propodeum hairless except laterally; pale markings absent; scutellum not angulate laterally; terga without impunctate margins (male unknown) (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Pachyanthidium (in part) of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- T5 with posterior marginal zone either not depressed or weakly to strongly depressed, but if recognizable, then punctate like rest of tergum to impunctate, often over half as wide laterally as medially, this zone often ending in broad, smooth posterior margin, the anterior margin of depressed zone straight or curved, not angulate, or with small basal median angular projection
- First recurrent vein entering second submarginal cell; axillar margin rounded or straight; face without longitudinal median ridge
- Basal area of propodeum with hairs, sometimes very short; pale markings usually present, but if not [as in Gnathanthidium and Afranthidium (Immanthidium), etc.], then scutellum usually angulate laterally and terga with impunctate marginal zones
- Preoccipital ridge dorsally and omaulus produced as translucent lamellae (Africa, Oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Neanthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- T5 with posterior marginal zone either not depressed or weakly to strongly depressed, but if recognizable, then punctate like rest of tergum to impunctate, often over half as wide laterally as medially, this zone often ending in broad, smooth posterior margin, the anterior margin of depressed zone straight or curved, not angulate, or with small basal median angular projection
- First recurrent vein entering second submarginal cell; axillar margin rounded or straight; face without longitudinal median ridge
- Basal area of propodeum with hairs, sometimes very short; pale markings usually present, but if not [as in Gnathanthidium and Afranthidium (Immanthidium), etc.], then scutellum usually angulate laterally and terga with impunctate marginal zones
- Preoccipital ridge and omaulus rounded or at most carinate (except preoccipital ridge lamellate inGnathanthidium)
- Subantennal suture straight or weakly arcuate; S4 and S5 of male not strongly concave, rather simple, S3 to S5 without combs or areas of specialized bristles, posterior margins straight or weakly concave (with lateral projections in Neanthidium and on S5 in Gnathanthidium)
- T6 and T7 of male each with four large equidistant teeth; S4 and S5 of male with lateral projections; T6 of female with lateral spine and median emargination (length 9-13 mm) (Mediterranean)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Gnathanthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- T5 with posterior marginal zone either not depressed or weakly to strongly depressed, but if recognizable, then punctate like rest of tergum to impunctate, often over half as wide laterally as medially, this zone often ending in broad, smooth posterior margin, the anterior margin of depressed zone straight or curved, not angulate, or with small basal median angular projection
- First recurrent vein entering second submarginal cell; axillar margin rounded or straight; face without longitudinal median ridge
- Basal area of propodeum with hairs, sometimes very short; pale markings usually present, but if not [as in Gnathanthidium and Afranthidium (Immanthidium), etc.], then scutellum usually angulate laterally and terga with impunctate marginal zones
- Preoccipital ridge and omaulus rounded or at most carinate (except preoccipital ridge lamellate inGnathanthidium)
- Subantennal suture straight or weakly arcuate; S4 and S5 of male not strongly concave, rather simple, S3 to S5 without combs or areas of specialized bristles, posterior margins straight or weakly concave (with lateral projections in Neanthidium and on S5 in Gnathanthidium)
- T6 of male simple, T7 short, bidentate, bilobed, or tridentate; S4 and S5 without lateral projections or (in Gnathanthidium) S5 with such projections; T6 of female without or with very weak lateral spine and median emargination
- Mandible of female with 13 or 14 teeth, apex broad, lower two teeth and upper one large, others small and subequal; scutellum transverse, truncate, carinate; tibiae coarsely tuberculate (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Afranthidium (in part) of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- T5 with posterior marginal zone either not depressed or weakly to strongly depressed, but if recognizable, then punctate like rest of tergum to impunctate, often over half as wide laterally as medially, this zone often ending in broad, smooth posterior margin, the anterior margin of depressed zone straight or curved, not angulate, or with small basal median angular projection
- First recurrent vein entering second submarginal cell; axillar margin rounded or straight; face without longitudinal median ridge
- Basal area of propodeum with hairs, sometimes very short; pale markings usually present, but if not [as in Gnathanthidium and Afranthidium (Immanthidium), etc.], then scutellum usually angulate laterally and terga with impunctate marginal zones
- Preoccipital ridge and omaulus rounded or at most carinate (except preoccipital ridge lamellate inGnathanthidium)
- Subantennal suture straight or weakly arcuate; S4 and S5 of male not strongly concave, rather simple, S3 to S5 without combs or areas of specialized bristles, posterior margins straight or weakly concave (with lateral projections in Neanthidium and on S5 in Gnathanthidium)
- T6 of male simple, T7 short, bidentate, bilobed, or tridentate; S4 and S5 without lateral projections or (in Gnathanthidium) S5 with such projections; T6 of female without or with very weak lateral spine and median emargination
- Mandible of female with eight teeth or less; scutellum rounded as seen from above, sometimes weakly emarginate medially, not or incompletely carinate; tibiae tuberculate or not (Africa, palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Indanthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- T7 of male nearly as wide as T6, multidentate; subantennal suture arising at upper end of tentorial pit (S3 of male without wavy bristles; S5 with margin strongly concave but no lateral projections) (India)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Pseudoanthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- T7 of male markedly narrower than T6, twoor threetoothed or lobed; subantennal suture arising from epistomal suture well above tentorial pit [except in P. (Royanthidium) reticulatum Mocsáry]
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Aspidosmia of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Hind tibia of female with scopa-like hairs, some of them at least as long as tibial width; basal vein of forewing curved (as in Halictus but less strongly) and meeting vein Cu at a right angle; jugal lobe of hind wing about half as long as vannal lobe (y ellow markings absent except on clypeus of male) (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Icteranthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Lower part of preoccipital carina sloping forward and continuing directly to lower mandibular articulation; axilla frequently pointed posteriorly (anterior coxa with lamella in most species; hind trochanter of male with preapical ridge, carina, lamella or tooth on inner surface; arolia absent) (palearctic, Sahel)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Euaspis of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Face with three longitudinal ridges or carinae, two of them juxtantennal carinae and the third—a median longitudinal one on frons and supraclypeal area—often only a shiny ridge (body without yellow markings)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Trachusoides of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Claws of female simple (male unknown) (India)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Trachusa of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- T7 of male curled under, dorsal surface thus facing downward; mandible of female dull, minutely roughened and bearing very short hairs, carinae absent on basal half of mandible; middle tibia with anterior margin strongly convex, at lowermost extremity usually at right angle to line across distal end of tibia (Fig. 82-4c)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Apianthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- T7 of male directed posteriorly although small, short, and transverse; mandible of female slightly shining, carinae strongly shining; middle tibia with anterior margin less strongly convex, at acute angle to line across distal end of tibia (Borneo)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Acedanthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Anterior part of axilla produced to a point or lobe directed laterally, behind which margin is concave; margin of T7 of male with median point and two lobes on each side, thus with ﬁve apical projections (India)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Larinostelis of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- Axilla positioned and produced laterally, thus almost abutting posterior end of tegula; arolia absent; scopa absent (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Eoanthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- Juxtantennal carinae present although sometimes weak; interantennal distance usually less than, rarely equal to, antennocular distance; S6 of female (except in subgenusClistanthidium) with spine or premarginal ridge, sometimes weak and lateral only, sternal margin thus appearing thick, sometimes elevated to lateral tooth (T7 of male over half as wide as T6) (palearctic, oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Cyphanthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- T6 of male with median apical tooth or small projection; body length 8.5 mm or less and metasoma with continuous yellow bands [form and coloration as in Afranthidium (Oranthidium)] (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Plesianthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- Yellow or cream markings absent or limited to face of male; T3 and other terga with depressed premarginal zone sublaterally nearly one-half length of exposed part of tergum; T6 of male with median lobe (often subtruncate and elevated) and lateral tooth, thus triﬁd or (in subgenusSpinanthidiellum) truncate with a longitudinal median ridge at apex (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Benanthis of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- Apex of T7 of male strongly bilobed; S4 and S5 of male simple, without combs or lateral teeth, margin of S6 with lateral lobe resembling a tooth in side view; ocelloccipital distance about equal to ocellar diameter (Madagascar)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Rhodanthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- Apex of T7 of male with a median projection, thus with three projections (or ﬁve in subgenus Meganthidium); S4 or S5 of male frequently with marginal comb, S5 often with lateral tooth, S6 without lateral projection; ocelloccipital distance two or more ocellar diameters (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Bathanthidium of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- Omaular carina absent or extending down only to middle of mesepisternum; T7 of male, if trilobed, then with median lobe much longer than lateral lobe or spine; subantennal suture straight (eastern Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Anthidiellum (in part) of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- Omaular carina strong, sometimes lamellate, and extending onto ventral surface of thorax, sometimes across venter (except in subgenus Clypanthidium, in which omaular carina does not reach lower part of mesepisternum); T7 of male, if trilobed, then with median lobe small, either not separated from lateral lobe by emargination or not longer than lateral lobe; subantennal suture usually arcuate outward (Fig. 82-5c)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Stelis (in part) of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- T egula of ordinary size and shape, widest medially and longer than wide (scutum wider than long, only moderately so in subgenus Stelidomorpha)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Afrostelis of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- Scutum longer than wide; body without yellow markings (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Xenostelis of the Anthidiini of the EasternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a)(See also the Supplementary Characteristics to Males, below.):
- Mandible of female with 5 to 18, usually sharp teeth separated by acute notches (Fig. 82-3a) or (in one species of Pachyanthidium) minutely denticulate; maxillary palpus minute [relatively long in Afranthidium (Zosteranthidium)], two-segmented (arolia absent; base of propodeal triangle punctate or ﬁnely roughened, nearly always hairy; propodeum without basal series of pits and without fovea behind spiracle; juxtantennal carina absent) (Series B)
- Scutum slightly broader than long; metasoma with yellow markings (Yeman)
=====
Characteristics to Males of the Anthidiine Gen-era of the Eastern Hemisphere(From Griswold and Michener, 1994a)The preceding key will be frustrating for various reasons,chief among which will likely be that couplet 1 is basedlargely on a character of females; supplementary charac-ters will help, but as indicated within the couplet, they arenot always decisive. The following supplementary key formales leads either to certain genera or to numbered cou-plets in the main key, thus bypassing couplet 1. In reality,its main function is to help identify males of taxa thatshould run to 11 in the main key and that lack arolia, asdo all taxa that run to 2. A. Paleotropical species ................................................ C—. Palearctic species .................................................. go to2C(B). Vein cu-v of hind wing less than half as long as secondabscissa of M/H11001Cu (as in Fig. 82-1b, c), oblique or trans-verse; middle tibia narrower than hind tibia.................... ED(C). T7 directed posteriorly although small, short, and trans-verse; middle tibia with anterior margin less strongly con-vex, thus at acute angle to line across distal end of tibia(as in Fig. 82-4d, e) ....................................ApianthidiumE(C). Axilla almost entirely lateral to lateral margin of scu-tum; outer, apical margins of fore and middle tibiae eachwith two minute spines (placed on basis of female char-acters; male unknown) ....................................Larinostelis—. Preoccipital carina present dorsally, behind vertex .... H—. Preoccipital carina absent dorsally, behind vertex .......... IH(G). SerapistaCharacteristics to the Genera B of the Anthidiini of the WesternHemisphere:
- In reality, its main function is to help identify males of taxa that should run to 11 in the main key and that lack arolia, as do all taxa that run to 2. A. Arolia absent
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Immanthidium) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Marginal zones of T2 to T5 broadly impunctate, median lengths of impunctate zones usually one-sixth length of exposed parts of terga or more, these zones transparent, pale brown or cream-colored; male gonostylus enormous, broad, ﬂat, and almost membranous; pronotal lobe not carinate, sometimes with small punctate and hairy ridge in position of carina (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Zosteranthidium) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Marginal zones of T2 to T5 punctate or narrowly impunctate, median lengths of impunctate zones about one-seventh lengths of exposed parts of terga or less, these zones dark or translucent brownish; male gonostylus neither broad nor ﬂat nor almost membranous although sometimes broadly paddle-shaped; pronotal lobe usually with transverse carina or low lamella that is hairless even when it extends only partway across lobe
- Scutellum and axilla laterally not much overhanging as seen obliquely so as to show proﬁles; scutellum rounded in proﬁle, not or scarcely overhanging metanotum; outer surfaces of tibiae not more coarsely punctate than mesepisternum, not tuberculate
- T2 to T5 with apical bands, broken medially, of white plumose hair; propodeal triangle with punctures (and hairs) widely separated from one another, surface between punctures strongly shagreened, dull; body and legs black, without pale markings (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Nigranthidium) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Marginal zones of T2 to T5 punctate or narrowly impunctate, median lengths of impunctate zones about one-seventh lengths of exposed parts of terga or less, these zones dark or translucent brownish; male gonostylus neither broad nor ﬂat nor almost membranous although sometimes broadly paddle-shaped; pronotal lobe usually with transverse carina or low lamella that is hairless even when it extends only partway across lobe
- Scutellum and axilla laterally not much overhanging as seen obliquely so as to show proﬁles; scutellum rounded in proﬁle, not or scarcely overhanging metanotum; outer surfaces of tibiae not more coarsely punctate than mesepisternum, not tuberculate
- T2 to T5 without apical hair bands; propodeal triangle rather densely punctate and hairy, surface between punctures shining; body and legs usually with yellow or white markings, but if not, then at least anterior surfaces of front and middle tibiae brownish yellow
- Hind basitarsus of female with apical projection over base of second tarsal segment; hind trochanter of male with apicoventral denticle; sterna of male with distinct basal hair fasciae arising at graduli; body black, with yellow or cream color usually limited to minute streak along inner margin of eye of both sexes (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Domanthidium) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Marginal zones of T2 to T5 punctate or narrowly impunctate, median lengths of impunctate zones about one-seventh lengths of exposed parts of terga or less, these zones dark or translucent brownish; male gonostylus neither broad nor ﬂat nor almost membranous although sometimes broadly paddle-shaped; pronotal lobe usually with transverse carina or low lamella that is hairless even when it extends only partway across lobe
- Scutellum and axilla laterally not much overhanging as seen obliquely so as to show proﬁles; scutellum rounded in proﬁle, not or scarcely overhanging metanotum; outer surfaces of tibiae not more coarsely punctate than mesepisternum, not tuberculate
- T2 to T5 without apical hair bands; propodeal triangle rather densely punctate and hairy, surface between punctures shining; body and legs usually with yellow or white markings, but if not, then at least anterior surfaces of front and middle tibiae brownish yellow
- Hind basitarsus of female with apex truncate, without apical projection; hind trochanter of male without apicoventral denticle; sterna of male without basal hair fasciae; body brown or black with yellow or cream-colored areas at least on face of male and metasomal terga of both sexes
- T5 of female without lateral spine; T1 of female with carina separating anterior from dorsal surfaces abruptly strengthened laterally and thence extended lateroposteriorly; apex of T7 of male with two lobes, each lobe two or three times as broad as long, emargination between them with small median spine; S6 of male with small, pointed midapical process at base of which are two spines directed forward (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Oranthidium) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
