- Marginal zones of T2 to T5 punctate or narrowly impunctate, median lengths of impunctate zones about one-seventh lengths of exposed parts of terga or less, these zones dark or translucent brownish; male gonostylus neither broad nor ﬂat nor almost membranous although sometimes broadly paddle-shaped; pronotal lobe usually with transverse carina or low lamella that is hairless even when it extends only partway across lobe
- Scutellum and axilla laterally not much overhanging as seen obliquely so as to show proﬁles; scutellum rounded in proﬁle, not or scarcely overhanging metanotum; outer surfaces of tibiae not more coarsely punctate than mesepisternum, not tuberculate
- T2 to T5 without apical hair bands; propodeal triangle rather densely punctate and hairy, surface between punctures shining; body and legs usually with yellow or white markings, but if not, then at least anterior surfaces of front and middle tibiae brownish yellow
- Hind basitarsus of female with apex truncate, without apical projection; hind trochanter of male without apicoventral denticle; sterna of male without basal hair fasciae; body brown or black with yellow or cream-colored areas at least on face of male and metasomal terga of both sexes
- T5 of female with lateral spine; T1 carina of female unmodiﬁed; apex of T7 of male two-lobed, usually with median angle or tooth, or three-lobed, each lateral lobe about as long as broad or longer; S6 of male without small apical process and spines
- Gonostylus of male tapering, not or scarcely longer than gonocoxite, not attaining middle of penis valve; ventral surface of mesepisternum of female covered with strong, backward-directed, golden to black bristles that appear ﬂattened, minutely barbed, and blunt or abruptly tapered at apices (S6 of male elongate, produced to narrowly rounded or bidentate apex) (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Afranthidium s. str.) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Marginal zones of T2 to T5 punctate or narrowly impunctate, median lengths of impunctate zones about one-seventh lengths of exposed parts of terga or less, these zones dark or translucent brownish; male gonostylus neither broad nor ﬂat nor almost membranous although sometimes broadly paddle-shaped; pronotal lobe usually with transverse carina or low lamella that is hairless even when it extends only partway across lobe
- Scutellum and axilla laterally not much overhanging as seen obliquely so as to show proﬁles; scutellum rounded in proﬁle, not or scarcely overhanging metanotum; outer surfaces of tibiae not more coarsely punctate than mesepisternum, not tuberculate
- T2 to T5 without apical hair bands; propodeal triangle rather densely punctate and hairy, surface between punctures shining; body and legs usually with yellow or white markings, but if not, then at least anterior surfaces of front and middle tibiae brownish yellow
- Hind basitarsus of female with apex truncate, without apical projection; hind trochanter of male without apicoventral denticle; sterna of male without basal hair fasciae; body brown or black with yellow or cream-colored areas at least on face of male and metasomal terga of both sexes
- T5 of female with lateral spine; T1 carina of female unmodiﬁed; apex of T7 of male two-lobed, usually with median angle or tooth, or three-lobed, each lateral lobe about as long as broad or longer; S6 of male without small apical process and spines
- Gonostylus of male expanded apically, about twice as long as gonocoxite, attaining apex of penis valve or nearly so; ventral surface of mesepisternum of female with pale, gradually tapering hairs similar to hairs of adjacent areas (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Mesanthidium) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Marginal zones of T2 to T5 punctate or narrowly impunctate, median lengths of impunctate zones about one-seventh lengths of exposed parts of terga or less, these zones dark or translucent brownish; male gonostylus neither broad nor ﬂat nor almost membranous although sometimes broadly paddle-shaped; pronotal lobe usually with transverse carina or low lamella that is hairless even when it extends only partway across lobe
- Scutellum laterally and usually axilla overhanging large fossa and usually acute or narrowly rounded, as seen obliquely so as to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum and of axilla; scutellum acute, right-angular, or sometimes rounded in proﬁle, medially often strongly overhanging metanotum; outer surfaces of tibiae, especially of female, coarsely, irregularly punctate, sometimes with extensive smooth areas between punctures, the punctures commonly coarser than those of mesepisternum, surfaces usually tuberculate (but not or weakly so in Capanthidium and Mesanthidium)
- Posterior margins of metasomal terga not curved upward, lying near surfaces of following terga; axilla extending laterally beyond scutal margin; male gonostylus greatly reduced, attaining about middle of penis valves, which are completely fused to one another (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Xenanthidium) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Marginal zones of T2 to T5 punctate or narrowly impunctate, median lengths of impunctate zones about one-seventh lengths of exposed parts of terga or less, these zones dark or translucent brownish; male gonostylus neither broad nor ﬂat nor almost membranous although sometimes broadly paddle-shaped; pronotal lobe usually with transverse carina or low lamella that is hairless even when it extends only partway across lobe
- Scutellum laterally and usually axilla overhanging large fossa and usually acute or narrowly rounded, as seen obliquely so as to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum and of axilla; scutellum acute, right-angular, or sometimes rounded in proﬁle, medially often strongly overhanging metanotum; outer surfaces of tibiae, especially of female, coarsely, irregularly punctate, sometimes with extensive smooth areas between punctures, the punctures commonly coarser than those of mesepisternum, surfaces usually tuberculate (but not or weakly so in Capanthidium and Mesanthidium)
- Posterior margins of at least some metasomal terga, as seen in proﬁle, curved upward away from following terga; axilla not extending laterally beyond scutum (except in someBranthidium); male gonostylus reaching to or beyond level of apical one-fourth of penis valves
- T6 of female with preapical denticulate ridge parallel to denticulate apical margin (scutellum distinctly carinate except for small midapical emargination) (male unknown) (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Capanthidium) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Marginal zones of T2 to T5 punctate or narrowly impunctate, median lengths of impunctate zones about one-seventh lengths of exposed parts of terga or less, these zones dark or translucent brownish; male gonostylus neither broad nor ﬂat nor almost membranous although sometimes broadly paddle-shaped; pronotal lobe usually with transverse carina or low lamella that is hairless even when it extends only partway across lobe
- Scutellum laterally and usually axilla overhanging large fossa and usually acute or narrowly rounded, as seen obliquely so as to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum and of axilla; scutellum acute, right-angular, or sometimes rounded in proﬁle, medially often strongly overhanging metanotum; outer surfaces of tibiae, especially of female, coarsely, irregularly punctate, sometimes with extensive smooth areas between punctures, the punctures commonly coarser than those of mesepisternum, surfaces usually tuberculate (but not or weakly so in Capanthidium and Mesanthidium)
- Posterior margins of at least some metasomal terga, as seen in proﬁle, curved upward away from following terga; axilla not extending laterally beyond scutum (except in someBranthidium); male gonostylus reaching to or beyond level of apical one-fourth of penis valves
- T6 of female without preapical denticulate ridge
- T6 of male with preapical, usually denticulate transverse ridge at least laterally; tibiae coarsely punctate but not or weakly tuberculate on outer surfaces (Africa, palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Mesanthidiellum) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Preoccipital carina present laterally; male S3 with trapezoidal apical projection; T5 and T6 of male with lobate lateral carinae, T5 and T6 of female with lateral longitudinal carinae (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Branthidium) of Afranthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Preoccipital carina absent; male S3 margin not produced; T5 (usually) and T6 without lateral carinae in either sex (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Ananthidiellum) of Anthidiellum:
- T erga not swollen laterally; S5 of male with margin broadly concave and armed with comb of black teeth, at least laterally (male unknown in Ananthidiellum); mandible of female without preapical shoulder on lower margin (Eastern Hemisphere)
- Mandible of female minutely sculptured, dull, almost without carinae, its apex expanded, 1.5 times as wide as basal width; subantennal suture straight; T1 to T4 without pale markings (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Chloranthidiellum) of Anthidiellum:
- T erga not swollen laterally; S5 of male with margin broadly concave and armed with comb of black teeth, at least laterally (male unknown in Ananthidiellum); mandible of female without preapical shoulder on lower margin (Eastern Hemisphere)
- Mandible of female somewhat shining, often coarsely punctate (somewhat dull distally in Ranthidiellum and Clypanthidium), with carinae, its apex but little wider than base (except in Ranthidiellum); subantennal suture arcuate [not clearly recognizable and perhaps not arcuate inA. (Clypanthidium) bimaculatum (Friese)]; T1 to T4 with yellow, cream, or reddish bands (except in subgenus Clypanthidiumand some Ranthidiellum)
- Preoccipital carina present at sides, behind eyes, but absent behind vertex; lamella on pronotal lobe tapering but extending nearly as far mesad from lateral margin of scutum as laterad; axilla extending laterally beyond margin of scutum (basal zone of propodeum laterally horizontal with well-developed pits) (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Clypanthidium) of Anthidiellum:
- T erga not swollen laterally; S5 of male with margin broadly concave and armed with comb of black teeth, at least laterally (male unknown in Ananthidiellum); mandible of female without preapical shoulder on lower margin (Eastern Hemisphere)
- Mandible of female somewhat shining, often coarsely punctate (somewhat dull distally in Ranthidiellum and Clypanthidium), with carinae, its apex but little wider than base (except in Ranthidiellum); subantennal suture arcuate [not clearly recognizable and perhaps not arcuate inA. (Clypanthidium) bimaculatum (Friese)]; T1 to T4 with yellow, cream, or reddish bands (except in subgenus Clypanthidiumand some Ranthidiellum)
- Preoccipital carina complete, or present only behind vertex, or absent; lamella or carina on pronotal lobe usually extending little mesad from lateral margin of scutum; axilla not extending laterally beyond lateral margin of scutum
- T egula narrowly rounded posteriorly; omaular carina reaching about halfway down omaulus (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Pycnanthidium) of Anthidiellum:
- T erga not swollen laterally; S5 of male with margin broadly concave and armed with comb of black teeth, at least laterally (male unknown in Ananthidiellum); mandible of female without preapical shoulder on lower margin (Eastern Hemisphere)
- Mandible of female somewhat shining, often coarsely punctate (somewhat dull distally in Ranthidiellum and Clypanthidium), with carinae, its apex but little wider than base (except in Ranthidiellum); subantennal suture arcuate [not clearly recognizable and perhaps not arcuate inA. (Clypanthidium) bimaculatum (Friese)]; T1 to T4 with yellow, cream, or reddish bands (except in subgenus Clypanthidiumand some Ranthidiellum)
- Preoccipital carina complete, or present only behind vertex, or absent; lamella or carina on pronotal lobe usually extending little mesad from lateral margin of scutum; axilla not extending laterally beyond lateral margin of scutum
- T egula broadly rounded or almost transverse posteriorly; omaular carina extending to venter (in some Pycnanthidium very weak or perhaps absent on lower half of mesepisternum)
- T1 with carina separating anterior and dorsal surfaces; apex of mandible but little wider than base; body black with yellow or cream markings on all tagmata (Africa, oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Ranthidiellum) of Anthidiellum:
- T erga not swollen laterally; S5 of male with margin broadly concave and armed with comb of black teeth, at least laterally (male unknown in Ananthidiellum); mandible of female without preapical shoulder on lower margin (Eastern Hemisphere)
- Mandible of female somewhat shining, often coarsely punctate (somewhat dull distally in Ranthidiellum and Clypanthidium), with carinae, its apex but little wider than base (except in Ranthidiellum); subantennal suture arcuate [not clearly recognizable and perhaps not arcuate inA. (Clypanthidium) bimaculatum (Friese)]; T1 to T4 with yellow, cream, or reddish bands (except in subgenus Clypanthidiumand some Ranthidiellum)
- Preoccipital carina complete, or present only behind vertex, or absent; lamella or carina on pronotal lobe usually extending little mesad from lateral margin of scutum; axilla not extending laterally beyond lateral margin of scutum
- T egula broadly rounded or almost transverse posteriorly; omaular carina extending to venter (in some Pycnanthidium very weak or perhaps absent on lower half of mesepisternum)
- T1 without carina between anterior and dorsal surfaces; apex of mandible of female about 1.5 times as wide as base; body brown with red markings, or yellowish and black but without yellow on T1 to T4 (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Loyolanthidium) of Anthidiellum:
- Postgradular parts of T2 to T5 of females and to T6 of males swollen laterally, so that, from above, sides of metasoma seem lobed; S5 of male without comb; mandible of female with preapical shoulder on lower margin, below lower tooth
- Preoccipital ridge strongly carinate behind vertex; keirotrichiate area along upper margin of hind tibia not sharply deﬁned (Western Hemisphere)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Anthidiellum s. str.) of Anthidiellum:
- Postgradular parts of T2 to T5 of females and to T6 of males swollen laterally, so that, from above, sides of metasoma seem lobed; S5 of male without comb; mandible of female with preapical shoulder on lower margin, below lower tooth
- Preoccipital ridge not or scarcely carinate; keirotrichiate area along upper margin of hind tibia sharply deﬁned (palearctic region, India)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Callanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- T6 of female with deep median emargination about oneﬁfth as wide as tergum, and strong lateral tooth about midway between base and apex of exposed part of tergum, T6 thus appearing strongly four-toothed; S6 of male with two large, erect, heavily sclerotized, bare apical lobes between which lie the greatly elongated, retrorsely bent apices of the penis valves (nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Anthidium s. str.) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely
- Scutellum rounded in proﬁle, not carinate or lamellate, not greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe with or without carina
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Nivanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely
- Scutellum angulate in proﬁle (at least as seen obliquely to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum), strongly carinate or lamellate at least laterally, greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe carinate or lamellate
- Pronotal lobe carinate; axillar suture weak; scutoscutellar suture not in deep depression, scutellum thus nearly continuing proﬁle of scutum (scutellum strongly produced posteriorly as rather ﬂat structure ending in lamella) (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Severanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely
- Scutellum angulate in proﬁle (at least as seen obliquely to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum), strongly carinate or lamellate at least laterally, greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe carinate or lamellate
- Pronotal lobe with more or less anteriorly directed or erect, translucent lamella; axillar suture strong; scutoscutellar suture in depression, scutellum thus independently convex in proﬁle
- Scutellum ending in lamella or large carina almost all the way across; hind basitarsus with longitudinal carina on outer surface; omaulus sharply angulate or weakly carinate
- Posterior scutellar margin subtruncate as seen from above, its lateral part curved forward and becoming more or less longitudinal; antennae arising below level of middles of eyes, which converge strongly below, rendering clypeus unusually small (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Gulanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely
- Scutellum angulate in proﬁle (at least as seen obliquely to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum), strongly carinate or lamellate at least laterally, greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe carinate or lamellate
- Pronotal lobe with more or less anteriorly directed or erect, translucent lamella; axillar suture strong; scutoscutellar suture in depression, scutellum thus independently convex in proﬁle
- Scutellum ending in lamella or large carina almost all the way across; hind basitarsus with longitudinal carina on outer surface; omaulus sharply angulate or weakly carinate
- Posterior scutellar margin broadly rounded as seen from above, with small median emargination, laterally oblique, only at extreme end next to axilla sometimes becoming longitudinal; antennae arising near level of middles of eyes, which converge slightly to moderately(palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Turkanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely
- Scutellum angulate in proﬁle (at least as seen obliquely to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum), strongly carinate or lamellate at least laterally, greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe carinate or lamellate
- Pronotal lobe with more or less anteriorly directed or erect, translucent lamella; axillar suture strong; scutoscutellar suture in depression, scutellum thus independently convex in proﬁle
- Scutellar margin with broad median part neither carinate nor lamellate; hind basitarsus not carinate; omaulus rounded or forming rounded angle
- Scutellum as seen from above with margin gradually curved forward at each side to axillar margin; hind basitarsus of female less than four times as long as broad (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Proanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely
- Scutellum angulate in proﬁle (at least as seen obliquely to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum), strongly carinate or lamellate at least laterally, greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe carinate or lamellate
- Pronotal lobe with more or less anteriorly directed or erect, translucent lamella; axillar suture strong; scutoscutellar suture in depression, scutellum thus independently convex in proﬁle
- Scutellar margin with broad median part neither carinate nor lamellate; hind basitarsus not carinate; omaulus rounded or forming rounded angle
- Scutellum as seen from above with margin more or less transverse, curved forward rather abruptly or angled forward at each side to axillar margin, angle often protruding posteriorly; hind basitarsus of female four or more times as long as broad (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Anthodioctes s. str.) of Anthodioctes:
- Pronotal lobe shorter anteroposteriorly than tegula; stigma about twice as long as prestigma
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Bothranthidium) of Anthodioctes:
- Pronotal lobe as long anteroposteriorly as tegula; stigma about as long as prestigma
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera B. (Bathanthidium s. str.) of Bathanthidium:
- Fovea behind propodeal spiracle rounded, delimited by strong carina; T7 of male trilobed, median lobe longest (upper margin of propodeum without row of pits except laterally) (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera B. (Manthidium) of Bathanthidium:
- Fovea behind propodeal spiracle elongate, weakly delimited; T7 of male simple or with slightly produced median lobe
- Basal zone of propodeum not distinct, with irregular, sculptured, sloping pits laterally; T6 of male with elevated median section and concave lateral sections (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera B. (Stenanthidiellum) of Bathanthidium:
- Fovea behind propodeal spiracle elongate, weakly delimited; T7 of male simple or with slightly produced median lobe
- Basal zone of propodeum distinct laterally, with regular, shiny, nearly horizontal pits; T6 of male with surface convex (eastern palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Dianthidium s. str.) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988):
- Hind coxa with elongate ventral, apical spine in male, short tooth (best seen in lateral view) in female; hypostomal area dulled by ﬁne, dense punctation (nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Deranchanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988):
- Hind coxa without tooth or spine; hypostomal area shiny between punctures
- Arolia absent; mouthparts in repose scarcely exceeding proboscidial fossa (male S5 without sclerotized apical comb) (Mexico)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Adanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988):
- Hind coxa without tooth or spine; hypostomal area shiny between punctures
- Arolia present; mouthparts in repose considerably exceeding proboscidial fossa
- Male S5 with sclerotized apical comb; female mandible short, its length considerably less than maximum clypeal width (North America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Mecanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988):
- Hind coxa without tooth or spine; hypostomal area shiny between punctures
- Arolia present; mouthparts in repose considerably exceeding proboscidial fossa
- Male S5 without sclerotized apical comb; female mandible long, its length equal to maximum clypeal width (Mexico)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Hemidiellum) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Subantennal suture straight; inner surface of hind tibia curving onto upper margin without sharp line between keirotrichiate area and region of longer hairs (arolia present; scutoscutellar suture closed, similar to scutoaxillar suture; T4 to T6 of female and T5 and T6 of male with small lateral spines) (India)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Salemanthidium) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Subantennal suture strongly arcuate outward; inner surface of hind tibia ﬂat, keirotrichiate area ending abruptly at sharp, often carinate line along upper margin of tibia
- Arolia absent; proﬁle of T6 of female convex; T4 to T6 with lateral spines (scutoscutellar suture closed, similar to scutoaxillar suture) (India)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Clistanthidium) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Subantennal suture strongly arcuate outward; inner surface of hind tibia ﬂat, keirotrichiate area ending abruptly at sharp, often carinate line along upper margin of tibia
- Arolia present; proﬁle of T6 of female concave (convex distally in subgenus Clistanthidium); T4 and T5 without lateral spines
- Front coxa with strong carina or lamella transverse to axis of body or bending posteriorly and becoming longitudinal mesally; S6 of female not thickened apically, without lateral carina or spine; T6 of male with lateral tooth; scutoscutellar suture sometimes not very different from scutoaxillar suture (palearctic, Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Eoanthidium s. str.) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Subantennal suture strongly arcuate outward; inner surface of hind tibia ﬂat, keirotrichiate area ending abruptly at sharp, often carinate line along upper margin of tibia
- Arolia present; proﬁle of T6 of female concave (convex distally in subgenus Clistanthidium); T4 and T5 without lateral spines
- Front coxa without transverse carina or lamella; S6 of female thickened apically, with lateral carina or spine; T6 of male without lateral tooth; scutoscutellar suture open, with shiny impunctate ﬂoor divided medially to form two foveae (palearctic, Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Carloticola) of Epanthidium (Males):
- T egula widest in front of middle; body length 9 to 12 mm; lamella of pronotal lobe opaque, black or dusky (South America, Mexico)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Ananthidium) of Epanthidium (Males):
- T egula widest near middle; body length 6.5-8.0 mm; lamella of pronotal lobe translucent (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Carloticola) of Epanthidium (Females):
- T6 without longitudinal carina; lamella of pronotal lobe opaque, blackish (S6 with premarginal carina enlarged to form tooth on each side of apex of sternum)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Epanthidium s. str.) of Epanthidium (Females):
- T6 with longitudinal median carina; lamella of pronotal lobe translucent
- Clypeal apex truncate, nodulose, only slightly overhanging base of labrum, labrum therefore exposed when mandibles are closed; juxtantennal carina of Epanthidium type present although sometimes minute; S6 with premarginal carina enlarged to form one to four premarginal teeth
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Ananthidium) of Epanthidium (Females):
- T6 with longitudinal median carina; lamella of pronotal lobe translucent
- Clypeal apex broadly rounded, rather thin, scarcely nodulose, overhanging base of labrum, labrum therefore hidden when mandibles are closed; juxtantennal carina absent or virtually so; S6 without premarginal carina or teeth, margin thin
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Rhynostelis) of Hoplostelis:
- Scutellum bigibbous; scutum bigibbous posteriorly; propodeum without foveae or pits; omaulus lamellate almost to lower end; T1 without transverse carina at summit of anterior surface; T4 to T6 (at least in female) each with longitudinal median carina (Brazil)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplostelis s. str.) of Hoplostelis:
- Neither scutellum nor scutum bigibbous; propodeum with well-deﬁned fovea, divided by transverse carinae, behind spiracle, continued as basal propodeal zone divided into many pits or small foveae; omaulus carinate in upper one-half or one-third, rounded below; T1 with transverse carina at summit of anterior surface; terga without longitudinal median carinae
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Michanthidium) of Hypanthidioides:
- Mandible of female with long, smooth apical margin between two small, lower apical teeth and upper apical angle or tooth; surface of distal half of mandible of female dull and minutely granular, without longitudinal carinae or with slender carinae that do not extend onto basal half of mandible; mandible of male with upper tooth separated from middle tooth by broad concave margin, upper interspace nearly twice as long as lower interspace; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female with coarse, erect, curved or hooked hairs on undersurface
- Mandible of female without distinct upper apical tooth, surface without carinae; hind coxa of male with small apical spine directed mesad; distal margin of T6 of male with lateral tooth but otherwise unmodiﬁed
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Larocanthidium) of Hypanthidioides:
- Mandible of female with long, smooth apical margin between two small, lower apical teeth and upper apical angle or tooth; surface of distal half of mandible of female dull and minutely granular, without longitudinal carinae or with slender carinae that do not extend onto basal half of mandible; mandible of male with upper tooth separated from middle tooth by broad concave margin, upper interspace nearly twice as long as lower interspace; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female with coarse, erect, curved or hooked hairs on undersurface
- Mandible of female with strong upper apical tooth separated from long smooth margin by deep emargination, surface with usual carinae but carinae weak; hind coxa of male unarmed; distal margin of T6 of male with obtuse lateral tooth, margin medially expanded, elevated, sometimes bilobed
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dichanthidium) of Hypanthidioides:
- Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs
- T egula large, with depressed translucent marginal area expanded anterolaterally, much wider there than midlaterally; body hoplitiform (arolia present in both sexes; T7 of male bilobed)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Mielkeanthidium) of Hypanthidioides:
- Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs
- T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform
- Mandible of female three-toothed; S4 of male with small but strong basal median comb
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Ctenanthidium) of Hypanthidioides:
- Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs
- T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform
- Mandible of female four-toothed; S4 of male without comb
- Arolia well developed in both sexes; S3 of male with median marginal comb of coarse black setae that are shorter than hairs of fringe on same margin laterally
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Saranthidium) of Hypanthidioides:
- Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs
- T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform
- Mandible of female four-toothed; S4 of male without comb
- Arolia absent or extremely minute in females and some males; S3 of male without apical comb
- Arolia of male absent; T7 of male bilobed, emargination between lobes about as wide as a lobe; S5 of male with apical comb; tegula widest in front of middle
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dicranthidium) of Hypanthidioides:
- Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs
- T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform
- Mandible of female four-toothed; S4 of male without comb
- Arolia absent or extremely minute in females and some males; S3 of male without apical comb
- Arolia of male present; T7 of male with narrow apicolateral lobes, space between them much wider than a lobe or, rarely [as in H. (Moureanthidium) capixaba(Urban)], lobes triangular and separated by broad emargination; S5 of male without apical comb (but with rows of coarse setae in Dicranthidium); tegula widest near middle
- T6 and T7 of male curled anteriorly, their surfaces thus directed ventrad and processes of T7 overlapping S2; S3 or S4 to S6 of male hidden; hind coxa of male with one or more coarse peglike setae on mesal surface; omaular carina extending onto venter of thorax (scutellum produced to translucent apical carina except medially)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Moureanthidium) of Hypanthidioides:
- Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs
- T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform
- Mandible of female four-toothed; S4 of male without comb
- Arolia absent or extremely minute in females and some males; S3 of male without apical comb
- Arolia of male present; T7 of male with narrow apicolateral lobes, space between them much wider than a lobe or, rarely [as in H. (Moureanthidium) capixaba(Urban)], lobes triangular and separated by broad emargination; S5 of male without apical comb (but with rows of coarse setae in Dicranthidium); tegula widest near middle
- T6 and T7 of male not so strongly curled (except in Moureanthidium), T6 not clearly directed ventrad; S3 to S5 or S6 ordinarily visible; hind coxa of male without peglike setae; omaular carina on upper half of mesepisternum, disappearing or becoming irregular because of punctation below
- Scutellum swollen, biconvex; omaular carina extending onto lower half of mesepisternum as irregular line (hind tarsus of male elongate, ﬁrst two segments taken together as long as hind tibia)..H. (Hypanthidioides s. str.) —. Scutellum not biconvex; omaular carina not extending onto lower one-half or one-third of mesepisternum
- Hind tarsus of male elongate, ﬁrst two segments taken together as long as hind tibia; S3 of male with small median bilobed projection; T7 of male strongly curled, surface thus directed ventrad; juxtantennal carina longer than diameter of antennal socket
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthidulum) of Hypanthidioides:
- Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs
- T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform
- Mandible of female four-toothed; S4 of male without comb
- Arolia absent or extremely minute in females and some males; S3 of male without apical comb
- Arolia of male present; T7 of male with narrow apicolateral lobes, space between them much wider than a lobe or, rarely [as in H. (Moureanthidium) capixaba(Urban)], lobes triangular and separated by broad emargination; S5 of male without apical comb (but with rows of coarse setae in Dicranthidium); tegula widest near middle
- T6 and T7 of male not so strongly curled (except in Moureanthidium), T6 not clearly directed ventrad; S3 to S5 or S6 ordinarily visible; hind coxa of male without peglike setae; omaular carina on upper half of mesepisternum, disappearing or becoming irregular because of punctation below
- Scutellum swollen, biconvex; omaular carina extending onto lower half of mesepisternum as irregular line (hind tarsus of male elongate, ﬁrst two segments taken together as long as hind tibia)..H. (Hypanthidioides s. str.) —. Scutellum not biconvex; omaular carina not extending onto lower one-half or one-third of mesepisternum
- Hind tarsus of male shorter, ﬁrst two segments taken together shorter than hind tibia; S3 of male without median, bilobed projection; T7 of male not so strongly curled; juxtantennal carina about as long as diameter of antennal socket
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Tylanthidium) of Hypanthidium:
- Preoccipital carina present as a sharp although punctate ridge laterally, behind eye; mandible of male bidentate, with strong, broad emargination between teeth; S2 of male with strong projection on each side
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hypanthidium s. str.) of Hypanthidium:
- Preoccipital carina absent; mandible of male with indications of three teeth; S2 of male with at most weak convexity on each side
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera N. (Notanthidium s. str.) of Notanthidium:
- Body hoplitiform; clypeus of female largely impunctate, upper part tumescent, lower margin with sublateral projection; clypeus in both sexes not at all overhanging base of labrum; mandible of female porrect, with deep emargination in upper margin just beyond middle, width of its apex less than basal width, three-toothed
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera N. (Chrisanthidium) —. Omaulus rounded; mandible of female obscurely four- toothed ................................................ N. (Allanthidium) of Notanthidium:
- Body chalicodomiform; clypeus of female punctate, not tumescent, without apical projections; apical margin of clypeus in both sexes overhanging base of labrum; mandible of female of the usual shape, width of its apex at least as great as basal width, vaguely four-toothed or with long straight margin above two lowermost teeth, sometimes undulate, thus producing a vaguely ﬁvetoothed margin
- Omaulus carinate; mandible of female obscurely ﬁvetoothed
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Ausanthidium) of Pachyanthidium:
- Eyes hairless; preoccipital carina absent laterally, behind eyes
- Arolia present; mandible of female four-toothed (Namibia)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Pachyanthidium s. str.) of Pachyanthidium:
- Eyes hairless; preoccipital carina absent laterally, behind eyes
- Arolia absent; mandible of female usually ﬁveto tentoothed or denticulate (four-toothed only in Pachyanthidium micheneri Pasteels) (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Trichanthidium) of Pachyanthidium:
- Eyes with abundant, short hairs; preoccipital carina present laterally, behind eyes (mandible of female fourtoothed)
- T3 to T5 each with slender lateral spine; ocelli small, diameter about equal to width of base of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment; hind coxa not carinate; arolia present in male, absent in female (Africa, oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Trichanthidioides) of Pachyanthidium:
- Eyes with abundant, short hairs; preoccipital carina present laterally, behind eyes (mandible of female fourtoothed)
- T3 to T5 without lateral spines; ocelli of ordinary size, diameter greater than width of base of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment; hind coxa carinate; arolia absent (possibly with very minute arolia in both sexes) (Africa, Arabia)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Paranthidium s. str.) ofParanthidium:
- Propodeum with postspiracular fovea; T6 of male without lateral lobe; S4 of male with median comb, S5 with comb laterally (nearctic, Mesoamerica)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Rapanthidium) ofParanthidium:
- Propodeum without postspiracular fovea or with fovea only about the size of the spiracle; T6 of male with lateral lobe; sterna of male without combs (Mesoamerica)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Spinanthidiellum) of Plesianthidium:
- Preoccipital ridge with carina behind vertex; T6 of male truncate, without lateral tooth, with longitudinal ridge distally, highest at posterior margin of tergum; mandible less than twice as long as broad
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Carinanthidium) of Plesianthidium:
- Preoccipital ridge not carinate; T6 of male with median truncate or rounded to pointed projection, rarely weakly produced, and a strong lateral tooth; mandible over twice as long as broad
- S6 of female with strong longitudinal median carina; hind trochanter of male with mesal subapical spine; pubescence all black except for white on face of male
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Spinanthidium) of Plesianthidium:
- Preoccipital ridge not carinate; T6 of male with median truncate or rounded to pointed projection, rarely weakly produced, and a strong lateral tooth; mandible over twice as long as broad
- S6 of female not carinate; hind trochanter of male not spined; pubescence brown to gray, or with whitish on face and venter
- T7 of male strongly triﬁd, median tooth or lobe exceeding lateral ones; S5 of male without apical comb; maxillary palpus two-segmented
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Plesianthidium s. str.) of Plesianthidium:
- Preoccipital ridge not carinate; T6 of male with median truncate or rounded to pointed projection, rarely weakly produced, and a strong lateral tooth; mandible over twice as long as broad
- S6 of female not carinate; hind trochanter of male not spined; pubescence brown to gray, or with whitish on face and venter
- T7 of male with median tooth reduced to low prominence, tergum thus essentially biﬁd; S5 of male with apical comb; maxillary palpus three-segmented
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Micranthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Gena margined posteriorly by distinct preoccipital carina (gena narrower than eye as seen from side)
- Preoccipital carina behind vertex strongly produced back over front of thorax as a lamella; posterior basitarsus of male more than twice as long as broad (scutellum broadly truncate in dorsal view, posterior margin angulate laterally near axilla; tibiae not tuberculate but coarsely punctate; lateral lobe of S3 of male lamellate; clypeus of female with discal hairs bent down apically) (Africa, Arabia)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Semicarinella) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Gena margined posteriorly by distinct preoccipital carina (gena narrower than eye as seen from side)
- Preoccipital carina behind vertex rather weakly carinate; posterior basitarsus of male less than twice as long as broad (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Tuberanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Gena without preoccipital carina (scutellum rounded or medially emarginate as seen from above; tibiae tuberculate on outer surfaces at least in female; male without lamellate lateral lobe on S3; clypeus of female with discal hairs straight)
- Propodeum shagreened; T6 of male with strong apical, medially emarginate ﬂange; fore and middle basitarsi of female with long plumose hair (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Exanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Gena without preoccipital carina (scutellum rounded or medially emarginate as seen from above; tibiae tuberculate on outer surfaces at least in female; male without lamellate lateral lobe on S3; clypeus of female with discal hairs straight)
- Propodeum shiny where not punctate; T6 of male without emarginate ﬂange; fore and middle basitarsi of female with long but not plumose hair
- T6 of female with surface broadly and conspicuously excavated; T5 of female with small, midapical, marginal projecting lobe; exposed part of T7 of male longer than exposed part of T6, very deeply bilobed; S5 of male without strong lateral tooth or lobe (palearctic, Sudan)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Royanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Gena without preoccipital carina (scutellum rounded or medially emarginate as seen from above; tibiae tuberculate on outer surfaces at least in female; male without lamellate lateral lobe on S3; clypeus of female with discal hairs straight)
- Propodeum shiny where not punctate; T6 of male without emarginate ﬂange; fore and middle basitarsi of female with long but not plumose hair
- T6 of female with surface largely convex; T5 of female without midapical lobe; exposed part of T7 of male shorter than exposed part of T6, weakly to strongly bilobed; S5 of male with strong lateral process
- Clypeal apex of female fully exposed, coarsely denticulate, protruding; S3 and S4 of male broadly emarginate, or S3 with median V-shaped emargination, and S5 with apicolateral projection, all without combs or specialized hairs (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Pseudoanthidium s. str.) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a):
- Gena without preoccipital carina (scutellum rounded or medially emarginate as seen from above; tibiae tuberculate on outer surfaces at least in female; male without lamellate lateral lobe on S3; clypeus of female with discal hairs straight)
- Propodeum shiny where not punctate; T6 of male without emarginate ﬂange; fore and middle basitarsi of female with long but not plumose hair
- T6 of female with surface largely convex; T5 of female without midapical lobe; exposed part of T7 of male shorter than exposed part of T6, weakly to strongly bilobed; S5 of male with strong lateral process
- Clypeal apex of female largely hidden by hair, without shining premarginal ridge; S3 of male with comb of long, wavy bristles and S5 with comb at apex of apicolateral projection (palearctic, oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera R. (Rhodanthidium s. str.) of Rhodanthidium:
- T6 of male with median, produced truncation or rounded process and lateral tooth or strong shoulder; S5 of male with strong lateral tooth and median marginal comb; omaulus weakly carinate above; margin of scutellum with sharp edge laterally; female with apical projection or spine of fore and mid tibiae narrowly bidentate
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera R. (Asianthidium) of Rhodanthidium:
- T6 of male simple or with scarcely produced broad truncation, with or without strong shoulder or weak lateral tooth; S5 of male without lateral tooth, without comb; omaulus not carinate [or weakly so above in R. (Asianthidium) caturigense (Giraud) and its relatives]; margin of scutellum rounded, not forming sharp edge [except in R. (Asianthidium) caturigense]; female with apical projection of fore and mid tibiae either not notched or widely and shallowly emarginate
- T riﬁd apex (median tooth sometimes broad and rounded or truncate) of T7 of male occupying full width of tergum; pronotal lobe with lamella or carina [weak in R. (Asianthidium) glasunovi(Morawitz)]; head with background color black
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera R. (Meganthidium) of Rhodanthidium:
- T6 of male simple or with scarcely produced broad truncation, with or without strong shoulder or weak lateral tooth; S5 of male without lateral tooth, without comb; omaulus not carinate [or weakly so above in R. (Asianthidium) caturigense (Giraud) and its relatives]; margin of scutellum rounded, not forming sharp edge [except in R. (Asianthidium) caturigense]; female with apical projection of fore and mid tibiae either not notched or widely and shallowly emarginate
- T riﬁd apex of T7 of male much narrower than tergum, which has lateral angles rendering tergum ﬁve-toothed; pronotal lobe without or with very weak carina; head largely yellow
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Stelidomorpha) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere:
- Clypeus produced well over mandibles, its apex bilobed, strongly so in females; anterior spine of front and middle tibiae conspicuous, enlarged, curved posteriorly
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Malanthidium) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere:
- Axilla projecting laterally beyond lateral margin of scutum; scutellum strongly projecting over metanotum and propodeum (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Stelis s. str.) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere:
- Axilla not projecting laterally beyond margin of scutum; scutellum at most weakly projecting over metanotum and propodeum
- Scutellum not carinate laterally; head and thorax without light markings; hind tibial apex with two spines or angles (Fig. 82-13b), one near outer middle of apical tibial margin (if with only one spine, as in S. simillima Morawitz, then not on posterior apical angle) or the spines united to form truncate margin, the area sparsely hairy and the structure thus easily seen; omaulus not carinate
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Heterostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere:
- Axilla not projecting laterally beyond margin of scutum; scutellum at most weakly projecting over metanotum and propodeum
- Scutellum carinate laterally; head and thorax with light markings; hind tibial apex with a single spine (sometimes a mere angle) largely hidden in hairs (Fig. 82-13a) near the posterior apical angle of the tibia, in front of which the apex of the tibia presents a convex margin; omaulus usually carinate
- Hind basitarsus with carina along inner dorsal angle (Fig. 82-13a); middle tibia ﬂattened, apically enlarged, twice as wide apically as basally; S1 with transverse carina overhanging apical margin
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Protostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere:
- Axilla not projecting laterally beyond margin of scutum; scutellum at most weakly projecting over metanotum and propodeum
- Scutellum carinate laterally; head and thorax with light markings; hind tibial apex with a single spine (sometimes a mere angle) largely hidden in hairs (Fig. 82-13a) near the posterior apical angle of the tibia, in front of which the apex of the tibia presents a convex margin; omaulus usually carinate
- Hind basistarsus without carina; middle tibia not ﬂattened, little enlarged apically, at most 1.5 times as wide apically as basally; S1 without transverse carina
- Pronotum without notch between lobe and rest of pronotum; omaulus not carinate; carinate pitted basal zone of propodeum extending behind spiracle
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Pseudostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere:
- Axilla not projecting laterally beyond margin of scutum; scutellum at most weakly projecting over metanotum and propodeum
- Scutellum carinate laterally; head and thorax with light markings; hind tibial apex with a single spine (sometimes a mere angle) largely hidden in hairs (Fig. 82-13a) near the posterior apical angle of the tibia, in front of which the apex of the tibia presents a convex margin; omaulus usually carinate
- Hind basistarsus without carina; middle tibia not ﬂattened, little enlarged apically, at most 1.5 times as wide apically as basally; S1 without transverse carina
- Pronotum with notch between lobe and rest of pronotum; omaulus usually carinate; carinate pitted basal zone of propodeum not extending behind spiracle
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Heterostelis) of Stelis of the Western Hemisphere:
- Hind tibia with a single prominent tooth or tibial spine (usually hidden among hairs) on margin near apex of posterior margin of tibia; hind basitarsus with strong lamella-like carina along posterior margin, separated by longitudinal depression from longitudinal thickening of outer surface of basitarsus (Fig. 82-13a)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Dolichostelis) of Stelis of the Western Hemisphere:
- Hind tibia with an apical median tooth or tibial spine and a less prominent, rounded projection near apex of posterior margin of tibia; hind basitarsus unmodiﬁed
- Base of propodeum with zone set off by carina and divided into a series of pits (Fig. 82-14), this zone projecting subhorizontally behind vertical metanotum; anterior surface of mesepisternum impunctate at least below and set off from lateral surface by sharp angle or weak omaular carina
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Stelis s. str.) of Stelis of the Western Hemisphere:
- Hind tibia with an apical median tooth or tibial spine and a less prominent, rounded projection near apex of posterior margin of tibia; hind basitarsus unmodiﬁed
- Base of propodeum vertical or sloping, rarely subhorizontal, without series of pits or such pits usually present only laterally, this zone with about same slope as metanotum; anterior surface of mesepisternum punctate, omaular carina absent
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Trachusa s. str.) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere:
- Mandible of female with three more or less equidistant teeth; maxillary palpus as long as maximum width of galea, four-segmented (yellow markings absent except for face of male) (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Archianthidium) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere:
- Mandible of female fourto seven-toothed; maxillary palpus shorter than width of galea, threeor foursegmented
- Second recurrent vein entering second submarginal cell basal to second submarginal crossvein; T7 of male with median basal projection (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Orthanthidium) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere:
- Scutellum truncate posteriorly as seen from above, margin curved sharply forward laterally to meet longitudinal margin of axilla; eyes of female conspicuously diverging below; interocellar distance of female much less than half the ocelloccipital distance (male unknown) (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Paraanthidium) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere:
- Scutellum broadly rounded but medially emarginate; lateral margin of axilla convex but in general slanting; eyes of female subparallel; interocellar distance about half of ocelloccipital distance or somewhat greater (palearctic, oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Massanthidium) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere:
- Omaulus distinctly carinate, carina extending onto ventral surface of thorax close to middle coxa (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Metatrachusa) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere:
- Omaulus not carinate
- Arolia present in female, absent in male; S4 and S5 of male without combs (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Congotrachusa) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere:
- Omaulus not carinate
- Arolia minute if present; S4 and S5 of male with combs as in Paraanthidium(Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Heteranthidium) of Trachusaof North America:
- All tagmata with abundant yellow or cream-colored markings, including median tergal bands on metasoma
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Ulanthidium) of Trachusaof North America:
- Integument without yellow or cream-colored markings except usually on face of male and, in Legnanthidium, on apical metasomal tergal margins
- Arolia absent
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Legnanthidium) of Trachusaof North America:
- Integument without yellow or cream-colored markings except usually on face of male and, in Legnanthidium, on apical metasomal tergal margins
- Arolia present
- Second recurrent vein joining second submarginal cell basal to second submarginal crossvein; mandible of female four-toothed
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Trachusomimus) of Trachusaof North America:
- Integument without yellow or cream-colored markings except usually on face of male and, in Legnanthidium, on apical metasomal tergal margins
- Arolia present
- Second recurrent vein distal to second submarginal crossvein; mandible of female three-toothed
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Aglaoapis of the Dioxyini(From Michener, 1996b):
- Scutellum with posterior margin rounded
- Metanotum with median tooth; posterior lateral angle of scutum produced to a strong spine (as in Fig. 83-1); third valvula (gonostylus) of female with only minute hairs (palearctic, India, Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Megachile of the Megachilini (Females):
- Scopa present on S2 to S5 or S6 (Fig. 8-7); metasoma not tapering throughout its length (Fig. 8-3)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Coelioxys (in part) of the Megachilini (Females):
- Scopa absent; metasoma tapering from near base to narrow, often acutely pointed, apex (Figs. 8-2, 84-2, 84-3)
- Omaular carina present; scutellum with dorsal and posterior surfaces usually separated by distinct, sometimes carinate, angle; axilla almost always produced posteriorly to angle or spine (Fig. 84-6a)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Coelioxys: C. gracillima Pasteels of the Megachilini (Females):
- Scopa absent; metasoma tapering from near base to narrow, often acutely pointed, apex (Figs. 8-2, 84-2, 84-3)
- Omaular carina absent; scutellum with no distinct angle between dorsal and posterior surfaces; axilla rounded (Fig. 8-2)
- Preoccipital carina absent; axilla and scutellum forming a single rounded posterior margin, not separated by incision; base of propodeum with row of strong pits (Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Radoszkowskiana of the Megachilini (Females):
- Scopa absent; metasoma tapering from near base to narrow, often acutely pointed, apex (Figs. 8-2, 84-2, 84-3)
- Omaular carina absent; scutellum with no distinct angle between dorsal and posterior surfaces; axilla rounded (Fig. 8-2)
- Preoccipital carina present at sides of head; axilla separated by incision from scutellar margin; base of propodeum ﬁnely wrinkled (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Genera Megachile of the Megachilini (Females):
- Scopa present on S2 to S5 or S6 (Fig. 8-7); metasoma not tapering throughout its length (Fig. 8-3)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally
- Subocellar area of frons usually closely punctate and quite ﬂat, but if with smooth swollen area, then usually with a few punctures or divided medially by punctate zone
- Scutellum usually well punctured, hind margin not carinate and not overlying metanotum except sometimes for a median angle or tubercle
- Concavity of T1 lacking marginal carina; T1 without dorsal basal fascia of pale hairs (S6 of female usually notched laterally)
- Axilla short, not reaching posterior transverse tangent of scutellum; scutellum broadly rounded or subtriangular; T2 of male with sublateral, transverse, elongate fovea on surface behind gradulus (Fig. 84-7) (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Xerocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 complete, clearly evident at midline (Fig. 84-2)
- S6 of female without lateral notches; T2 of male without foveae
- Carina of pronotal tubercle conspicuously elevated, forming lamella anterior to tegula; pubescence of thorax shorter, scutum nearly bare but with marginal lines or spots of pale tomentum; gradulus of T2 approaching apical margin of tergum medially (nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Coelioxys s. str.) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 complete, clearly evident at midline (Fig. 84-2)
- S6 of female without lateral notches; T2 of male without foveae
- Carina of pronotal tubercle not elevated, often obscured by long, dense, thoracic pubescence; scutum and scutellum more conspicuously pubescent, but without pale tomentose lines or spots; gradulus of T2 more nearly straight, not closely approaching apical tergal margin (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Synocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally
- Median ocellus partially surrounded by somewhat swollen and usually smooth portion of subocellar frontal area
- S6 of female rounded or broadly angulate apically, with marginal fringe of short hairs, without subapical notch; metasoma of male with four exposed sterna, dorsal processes of T6 forming a transverse, irregularly crenulate plate (North and Central America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Neocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally
- Median ocellus partially surrounded by somewhat swollen and usually smooth portion of subocellar frontal area
- S6 of female narrowed apically, without marginal fringe, with lateral subapical notch; metasoma of male with ﬁve exposed sterna, dorsal processes of T6 normal
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Acrocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally
- Subocellar area of frons usually closely punctate and quite ﬂat, but if with smooth swollen area, then usually with a few punctures or divided medially by punctate zone
- Scutellum smooth, punctures well separated or sparse, hind margin carinate and usually angulate, projecting over metanotum and propodeum
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally
- Subocellar area of frons usually closely punctate and quite ﬂat, but if with smooth swollen area, then usually with a few punctures or divided medially by punctate zone
- Scutellum usually well punctured, hind margin not carinate and not overlying metanotum except sometimes for a median angle or tubercle
- Concavity of T1 lacking marginal carina; T1 without dorsal basal fascia of pale hairs (S6 of female usually notched laterally)
- Axilla short, not reaching posterior transverse tangent of scutellum; scutellum broadly rounded or subtriangular; T2 of male with sublateral, transverse, elongate fovea on surface behind gradulus (Fig. 84-7) (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Glyptocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally
- Subocellar area of frons usually closely punctate and quite ﬂat, but if with smooth swollen area, then usually with a few punctures or divided medially by punctate zone
- Scutellum usually well punctured, hind margin not carinate and not overlying metanotum except sometimes for a median angle or tubercle
- Concavity of T1 lacking marginal carina; T1 without dorsal basal fascia of pale hairs (S6 of female usually notched laterally)
- Axilla usually prominent; scutellum usually angulate or with median ridge or apical tubercle; T2 of male not foveate
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Haplocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally
- Subocellar area of frons usually closely punctate and quite ﬂat, but if with smooth swollen area, then usually with a few punctures or divided medially by punctate zone
- Scutellum usually well punctured, hind margin not carinate and not overlying metanotum except sometimes for a median angle or tubercle
- Concavity of T1 with dorsal marginal carina; T1 usually with more or less conspicuous pale basal fascia of hairs (i.e., on dorsum immediately behind basal concavity)
- S6 of female with small, lateral subapical notch; gena of male much narrowed below, hypostomal area lacking usual concavity (clypeus of female ﬂattened, its apical margin straight and simple)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Cyrtocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- Scutellum subtriangular, or, if broadly rounded posteriorly, then dorsal and posterior surfaces usually only indeﬁnitely separated (S6 of female usually fringed with setae)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Platycoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- S5 of female greatly expanded, hiding all but tip of S6; postgradular grooves of T3 to T5 in male not or only slightly fasciate; body length 6.5-7.2 mm (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Rhinocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973):
- S5 of female normal, S6 very narrow and elongate; postgradular grooves of T3 to T5 in male usually conspicuously fasciate; body usually much larger (clypeus in female variously modiﬁed) (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (T orridapis) of Coelioxys of the EasternHemisphere:
- Eyes bare
- S5 of female greatly elongated, forming part of apical metasomal elongation, exposed part far longer than exposed parts of S4 and S6 (Fig. 84-6c); S6 of female narrow, without long hairs, not fringed; T6 of female with out keel, without long erect hairs; T6 of male without lateral tooth (Fig. 84-6g) (Africa, oriental, Australia)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Liothyrapis) of Coelioxys of the EasternHemisphere:
- Eyes bare
- S5 of female not attenuate, exposed part not much if any longer than exposed parts of S4 and S6; S6 of female broad, its apex bluntly pointed or rounded, fringed; T6 of female with keel ending in bare apical spine, with long erect hairs lateral to keel (Fig. 84-6b); T6 of male with lateral basal tooth (Fig. 84-6f)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Allocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the EasternHemisphere:
- Eyes hairy
- T ransverse subocular carina (extending posteriorly from posterior mandibular articulation) joining preoccipital carina; subgenal fossa absent; T6 of male with eight teeth, two lateral, six apical
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Mesocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the EasternHemisphere:
- Eyes hairy
- T ransverse subocular carina (extending posteriorly from posterior mandibular articulation) absent or ending free, without approaching preoccipital carina, except in some males in which subocular carina is extended as margin of subgenal fossa, the margin continuing upward as preoccipital carina; T6 of male with six teeth or projections, two lateral, four apical
- Front and middle femora each with two strong but irregular longitudinal carinae on undersurfaces, one of the carinae of front femur elevated and keel-like, spaces between carinae densely covered with white, scale-like hairs; white areas or fasciae of body formed by white scales; T6 and S6 of female produced and slender but apices truncate
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C.(Boreocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the EasternHemisphere:
- Eyes hairy
- T ransverse subocular carina (extending posteriorly from posterior mandibular articulation) absent or ending free, without approaching preoccipital carina, except in some males in which subocular carina is extended as margin of subgenal fossa, the margin continuing upward as preoccipital carina; T6 of male with six teeth or projections, two lateral, four apical
- Front and middle femora unmodiﬁed; white areas of body formed by patches or fasciae of dense hairs or scalelike hairs; T6 and S6 of female usually pointed
- T2 of male with sublateral pit or fovea on each side behind postgradular groove (Fig. 84-7); S6 of female with lateral subapical notch
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Coelioxys s. str.) of Coelioxys of the EasternHemisphere:
- Eyes hairy
- T ransverse subocular carina (extending posteriorly from posterior mandibular articulation) absent or ending free, without approaching preoccipital carina, except in some males in which subocular carina is extended as margin of subgenal fossa, the margin continuing upward as preoccipital carina; T6 of male with six teeth or projections, two lateral, four apical
- Front and middle femora unmodiﬁed; white areas of body formed by patches or fasciae of dense hairs or scalelike hairs; T6 and S6 of female usually pointed
- T2 of male without foveae behind postgradular groove; S6 of female without lateral notch
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Melanosarus) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible ﬁve-toothed, a long cutting edge in second interspace, none elsewhere
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Moureapis) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible four-toothed, a well-formed cutting edge in third interspace
- Second interspace distinct, with cutting edge usually present
- Inner angle of mandible truncate, or apical margin of clypeus impressed medially (S6 rather narrowly truncate) (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Pseudocentron) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible four-toothed, a well-formed cutting edge in third interspace
- Second interspace distinct, with cutting edge usually present
- Inner angle of mandible acute or rounded; clypeal margin straight and entire
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Acentron) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible four-toothed, a well-formed cutting edge in third interspace
- Second interspace lacking or small, without cutting edge
- Mandible more robust, apical tooth more protuberant, much broader than other teeth; gena usually broader than eye in lateral view
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Leptorachis) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible four-toothed, a well-formed cutting edge in third interspace
- Second interspace lacking or small, without cutting edge
- Mandible less robust, apical tooth not much broader than second or third; gena usually narrow
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Grosapis) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- S6 with well-dispersed scopal hairs, or, if partly bare, then without bare apical rim behind transverse fringe of short hairs, or (in Argyropile) rim directed upward, or rim narrow and barely recognizable
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f), or with incomplete cutting edge in second interspace only (Fig. 84-12c); mandible with less than ﬁve teeth,or, if ﬁve-toothed, then upper two teeth (4 and 5) usually closer together than teeth 3 and 4
- Mandible with incomplete cutting edge in second interspace, and no cutting edges elsewhere (Fig. 84-12c)
- Body very large and robust (20 X 10 mm); vestiture entirely rufous; proﬁle of T6 straight (Mexico)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Sayapis) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- S6 with well-dispersed scopal hairs, or, if partly bare, then without bare apical rim behind transverse fringe of short hairs, or (in Argyropile) rim directed upward, or rim narrow and barely recognizable
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f), or with incomplete cutting edge in second interspace only (Fig. 84-12c); mandible with less than ﬁve teeth,or, if ﬁve-toothed, then upper two teeth (4 and 5) usually closer together than teeth 3 and 4
- Mandible with incomplete cutting edge in second interspace, and no cutting edges elsewhere (Fig. 84-12c)
- Body not so large and robust; vestiture not entirely rufous, that of metasomal terga dark with pale apical bands; proﬁle of T6 strongly concave distally because of projecting apical margin
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Megachile s. str.)(in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible clearly ﬁve-toothed, distance between upper two teeth not or only slightly less than distance between other pairs of teeth (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Chrysosarus) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- T6 nearly straight in proﬁle, with abundant erect pubescence (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Schrottkyapis) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Pronotal lobe with transverse hairless lamella hidden among hairs; mandible with third interspace narrowly Ushaped and much deeper than others (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Chelostomoides) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Pubescence largely white, not fulvous, forming narrow white apical bands on metasomal terga and sometimes narrow bands on postgradular grooves
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Stelodides) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible ﬁve-toothed; pubescence of thorax and metasoma black except for broad white band on T3 (Chile)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Gronoceras) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Apex of front tibia with three distinct sharp spines or teeth on outer surface; clypeus with longitudinal elevation, highest at lower clypeal margin (?Jamaica)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Callomegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandibular carinae minutely roughened, sometimes dull
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Pseudomegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandibular carinae shining and smooth (at 40 /H11003)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Argyropile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- S6 with apical rim dir ected upward beyond fringe of hairs, this rim conspicuous if tergum and sternum are spread apart (nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Ptilosarus) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Thoracic venter, including leg bases and S2, with dense covering of ﬁne, plumose hairs, sharply differentiated from other scopal hairs (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Eutricharaea) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible four-toothed, no cutting edge in second interspace (introduced, North America, Antilles, Chile, Argentina)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Trichurochile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible with fourth tooth emarginate, thus ﬁvetoothed, second interspace with conspicuous but incomplete cutting edge (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Tylomegachile)(in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Metasomal sterna not at all fasciate; segments 1 and 2 of hind tarsus not or little produced apically (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Megachiloides) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- T6 straight in proﬁle; mandible with second tooth often rounded or obtuse (Fig. 84-12a), usually no cutting edge in second interspace (nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Dasymegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Scopa black; body usually covered with long, dense hairs (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Litomegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Scopa white except on S6; body not densely covered with long hairs (nearctic) [The female of Megachile (Xanthosarus) addenda Cresson (couplet 24 of the ﬁrst key) runs to Litomegachile,from which, usually, it is immediately distinguishable by its large size, 12-17 mm in body length]
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Megachile s. str.)(in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible clearly ﬁve-toothed, distance between upper two teeth not or only slightly less than distance between other pairs of teeth (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Austromegachile) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Median area of clypeus somewhat elevated and strongly ﬂattened, sloping away on each side (apical margin of clypeus medially emarginate) (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Tylomegachile)(in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Metasomal sterna not at all fasciate; segments 1 and 2 of hind tarsus not or little produced apically (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Austromegachile) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Median area of clypeus somewhat elevated and strongly ﬂattened, sloping away on each side (apical margin of clypeus medially emarginate) (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Cressoniella) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible four-toothed, a well-formed cutting edge in third interspace
- Lateral ocellus considerably nearer to posterior margin of vertex than to eye
=====
