Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Xanthosarus) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible four-toothed, a well-formed cutting edge in third interspace
- Lateral ocellus usually as near as or nearer to eye than to posterior margin of vertex (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Rhyssomegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible four-toothed, a well-formed cutting edge in third interspace
- Preoccipital carina distinct behind gena; cutting edges of mandible obsolescent (lateral ocellus widely removed from occipital margin) (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Ptilosaroides) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible four-toothed, a well-formed cutting edge in third interspace
- Thorax and metasoma above densely and minutely punctate throughout, largely cov ered with appressed or suberect tomentum (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Neochelynia) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Females)(Partly from Mitchell, 1943, 1980):
- Mandible four-toothed, a well-formed cutting edge in third interspace
- Punctures of thorax and metasoma distinctly separated, surface not tomentose to any considerable degree
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Leptorachis) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur present, articulated, but small
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Pseudocentron) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Middle tibia with a spurlike apical prong (spur presumably fused to tibia), prong sometimes reduced to large, acute tooth
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Moureapis) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Middle tibia without such a process
- Front and middle tibia and tarsus simple and unmodiﬁed; front tarsus slender, usually black (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Acentron) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Middle tibia without such a process
- Front and middle tibia and tarsus modiﬁed, middle tibia broadened apically or angulate on lower margin; basitarsus usually excavated along anterior margin; front tarsus dilated and brightly colored
- Scutum ﬁnely and densely rugoso-punctate, punctures not individually distinguishable
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Melanosarus) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Middle tibia without such a process
- Front and middle tibia and tarsus modiﬁed, middle tibia broadened apically or angulate on lower margin; basitarsus usually excavated along anterior margin; front tarsus dilated and brightly colored
- Punctures of scutum usually well separated, but, if close, then individually distinguishable
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Chelostomoides) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Mandible three-toothed, toothed margin much shorter than distance from upper tooth to base of mandible; body not covered with rufous hairs
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Grosapis) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Mandible four-toothed, elongate, toothed margin as long as distance from upper tooth to base of mandible; body covered with long, rufous hairs (Mexico)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Schrottkyapis) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Pronotal lobe with erect, hairless transverse lamella (clypeus protuberant medially; mandible as described for Grosapisin couplet 7) (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Gronoceras) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- T6 with preapical brush of long hairs and two long, slender spines representing preapical carina (Fig. 84-18)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Callomegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- T6 without brush of long hairs and without long spines..11 11(10). T6 with carina short, low, not or shallowly emarginate, not denticulate (Fig. 84-14c)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Neochelynia) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- T6 more nearly horizontal, carina either deeply emarginate, with dorsal surface markedly concave, or surface convex, carina low, with only a small median notch
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Tylomegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Carina of T6 without emargination but with small median apical point (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Rhyssomegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Preoccipital carina strong behind genal area (front tarsus slender, dark) (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Zonomegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Anterior end of hypostomal area, immediately behind mandible, with strong, angular projection (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Ptilosaroides) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Front tarsus slender, black; carina of T6 represented principally by two spines, one on each side of emargination; mandible four-toothed (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Chrysosarus) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Mandible with low median or preapical inferior angle in place of usual tooth (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Dasymegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- First and second segments of ﬂagellum subequal (mandible three-toothed, middle tooth sometimes notched, suggesting a four-toothed condition) (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Trichurochile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Large emargination between teeth of carina of T6 ﬁlled by dense fringes of long, plumose hairs largely arising from the teeth (mandible three-toothed) (South America)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Cressoniella) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Mandible four-toothed; body length often 12 mm or more; pubescence erect and rather long
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Ptilosarus) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Mandible three-toothed; body smaller, length about 7 mm; pubescence short, appressed (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Neochelynia) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- T6 more nearly horizontal, carina either deeply emarginate, with dorsal surface markedly concave, or surface convex, carina low, with only a small median notch
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Austromegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- T6 vertical, completely hidden in dorsal view of metasoma, carina low and entire or with small median emargination (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Stelodides) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Pubescence of thorax and metasoma black except for broad white band on T3; mandible with small preapical inferior angle (Chile)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Sayapis) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Pubescence not forming above color pattern; mandible with large basal inferior projection
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Argyropile) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Front coxa hairy, without red bristles; front tarsus simple, dark-colored (nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Xanthosarus) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Front tarsus broadly dilated, pale (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Megachiloides) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- S4 without median apical tubercle, apical margin usually broadly membranous (nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Xanthosarus) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Front tarsus broadly dilated, pale (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Argyropile) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Front coxa hairy, without red bristles; front tarsus simple, dark-colored (nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Chrysosarus) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Mandible with low median or preapical inferior angle in place of usual tooth (neotropical)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Xanthosarus) (in part) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Front tarsus broadly dilated, pale (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Megachile s. str.) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Front coxal spine reduced to inconspicuous tubercle or absent (holarctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Eutricharaea) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Morphological apical margin (not carina) of T6 without evident teeth (introduced)
=====
Characteristics to the Subgenera M. (Litomegachile) of Megachile of the WesternHemisphere (Males):
- Middle tibial spur absent or much shorter than apical width of tibia, sometimes immovably fused to tibia, and middle basitarsus not or little modiﬁed (body megachiliform)
- Middle tibial spur absent or represented by prong immovably fused to tibia
- Morphological apical margin of T6 with four small but distinct teeth (nearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Creightonella) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible ﬁveor six-toothed, teeth (except the ﬁrst) similar and with similarly shaped incomplete cutting edges in second and third (and sometimes fourth) interspaces (Fig. 84-17d); apices of mandibular teeth roughly equidistant from nearest neighbors; preapical transverse mandibular groove distinct and ﬁlled with short, ﬁne, pale hairs (these not found in other subgenera with cutting edges)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Parachalicodoma) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible threeto ﬁve-toothed, without cutting edges, or, if with cutting edges, then teeth above ﬁrst of different shapes and cutting edges often of different shapes, or only one cutting edge present; apices of mandibular teeth commonly separated from nearest neighbors by different distances; preapical transverse mandibular groove, in forms with cutting edges, absent, or, if present, then not ﬁlled with short, pale hairs
- Mandible without cutting edges (Fig. 84-12d-f) (body chalicodomiform)
- Mandible with ﬁve fully distinct teeth, about equidistant (northern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Chalicodoma) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible threeto ﬁve-toothed, without cutting edges, or, if with cutting edges, then teeth above ﬁrst of different shapes and cutting edges often of different shapes, or only one cutting edge present; apices of mandibular teeth commonly separated from nearest neighbors by different distances; preapical transverse mandibular groove, in forms with cutting edges, absent, or, if present, then not ﬁlled with short, pale hairs
- Mandible without cutting edges (Fig. 84-12d-f) (body chalicodomiform)
- Mandible with three or four teeth
- Anterior margin of clypeus rounded (rarely weakly emarginate medially), strongly crenulate, produced well over base of labrum, not thickened; head little developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus not greater than interocellar distance (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Largella) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible threeto ﬁve-toothed, without cutting edges, or, if with cutting edges, then teeth above ﬁrst of different shapes and cutting edges often of different shapes, or only one cutting edge present; apices of mandibular teeth commonly separated from nearest neighbors by different distances; preapical transverse mandibular groove, in forms with cutting edges, absent, or, if present, then not ﬁlled with short, pale hairs
- Mandible without cutting edges (Fig. 84-12d-f) (body chalicodomiform)
- Mandible with three or four teeth
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin thickened and impunctate; head usually much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus greater than interocellar distance
- Apex of front tibia with three spines, posterior one less acute and hidden by dense, short hairs; mandible strongly expanded apically, outer margin thus concave in basal half, narrowest part little more than half as wide as apical margin (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Maximegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible threeto ﬁve-toothed, without cutting edges, or, if with cutting edges, then teeth above ﬁrst of different shapes and cutting edges often of different shapes, or only one cutting edge present; apices of mandibular teeth commonly separated from nearest neighbors by different distances; preapical transverse mandibular groove, in forms with cutting edges, absent, or, if present, then not ﬁlled with short, pale hairs
- Mandible without cutting edges (Fig. 84-12d-f) (body chalicodomiform)
- Mandible with three or four teeth
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin thickened and impunctate; head usually much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus greater than interocellar distance
- Apex of front tibia with one or usually two spines, posterior one absent; mandible not so expanded apically, outer margin not or weakly concave, narrowest part more than half as wide as apical margin
- Mandible elongate, more or less parallel-sided or narrowest preapically, with teeth across apex and mandibular ridges smooth and shining (at 40X) (southwestern Asia)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Pseudomegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible threeto ﬁve-toothed, without cutting edges, or, if with cutting edges, then teeth above ﬁrst of different shapes and cutting edges often of different shapes, or only one cutting edge present; apices of mandibular teeth commonly separated from nearest neighbors by different distances; preapical transverse mandibular groove, in forms with cutting edges, absent, or, if present, then not ﬁlled with short, pale hairs
- Mandible without cutting edges (Fig. 84-12d-f) (body chalicodomiform)
- Mandible with three or four teeth
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin thickened and impunctate; head usually much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus greater than interocellar distance
- Apex of front tibia with one or usually two spines, posterior one absent; mandible not so expanded apically, outer margin not or weakly concave, narrowest part more than half as wide as apical margin
- Mandible of ordinary shape or if elongated as above (as in some Callomegachile), then ridges minutely roughened and dull
- Mandible with ridges largely shiny, not dulled by microsculpturing (at 40X)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Callomegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible threeto ﬁve-toothed, without cutting edges, or, if with cutting edges, then teeth above ﬁrst of different shapes and cutting edges often of different shapes, or only one cutting edge present; apices of mandibular teeth commonly separated from nearest neighbors by different distances; preapical transverse mandibular groove, in forms with cutting edges, absent, or, if present, then not ﬁlled with short, pale hairs
- Mandible without cutting edges (Fig. 84-12d-f) (body chalicodomiform)
- Mandible with three or four teeth
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin thickened and impunctate; head usually much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus greater than interocellar distance
- Apex of front tibia with one or usually two spines, posterior one absent; mandible not so expanded apically, outer margin not or weakly concave, narrowest part more than half as wide as apical margin
- Mandible of ordinary shape or if elongated as above (as in some Callomegachile), then ridges minutely roughened and dull
- Mandible with ridges dulled by microsculpturing
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Chelostomoda) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible threeto ﬁve-toothed, without cutting edges, or, if with cutting edges, then teeth above ﬁrst of different shapes and cutting edges often of different shapes, or only one cutting edge present; apices of mandibular teeth commonly separated from nearest neighbors by different distances; preapical transverse mandibular groove, in forms with cutting edges, absent, or, if present, then not ﬁlled with short, pale hairs
- Mandible with cutting edge in at least one interspace, sometimes hidden behind margin of interspace (Fig. 8411)
- Mandible with cutting edge only in second interspace (as in Fig. 84-12c); body heriadiform, hoplitiform (as in Fig. 84-9), or chalicodomiform
- Metasomal sterna at least laterally with apical fasciae of white hair under scopa; mandible of ordinary shape, ﬁve-toothed
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Eumegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible threeto ﬁve-toothed, without cutting edges, or, if with cutting edges, then teeth above ﬁrst of different shapes and cutting edges often of different shapes, or only one cutting edge present; apices of mandibular teeth commonly separated from nearest neighbors by different distances; preapical transverse mandibular groove, in forms with cutting edges, absent, or, if present, then not ﬁlled with short, pale hairs
- Mandible with cutting edge in at least one interspace, sometimes hidden behind margin of interspace (Fig. 8411)
- Mandible with cutting edge only in second interspace (as in Fig. 84-12c); body heriadiform, hoplitiform (as in Fig. 84-9), or chalicodomiform
- Metasomal sterna without apical fasciae; mandible over twice as long as basal width, four-toothed (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Megachile s. str.) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with ﬁve teeth, distance between fourth and ﬁfth little less than distance between other teeth (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Megella) of Megachile (Females):
- Metasoma over twice as long as broad; body over 20 mm long (cutting edge in third interspace, behind interspace margin and not or only slightly exposed in frontal view; Fig. 84-11h) (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Xanthosarus) of Megachile (Females):
- Upper mandibular tooth broad (convex or truncate) or emarginate so that the mandible is ﬁve-toothed (Fig. 84-11a); sterna without apical hair bands beneath scopa; third interspace of mandible frequently deeper than others (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Eutricharaea) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible without or with only hidden or very small cutting edge in second interspace but with cutting edge in third interspace (rarely hidden behind interspace margin) (Fig. 84-11g)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Neocressoniella) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with upper interspace as long as or longer than rest of apical margin, cutting edge in upper interspace complete, occupying full length of interspace and over twice as long as incomplete cutting edge in second interspace (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Paracella) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with upper interspace shorter than rest of apical margin, cutting edge in upper interspace complete or incomplete, sometimes hidden, less than twice as long as incomplete cutting edge in second interspace (oriental)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Creightonella) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 (sometimes also S6) exposed and generally similar to preceding sterna (sometimes S5 largely hidden but S6 exposed); lateral extremity of carina of T6 directed basad, away from apical margin of tergum
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Chelostomoda) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- S4 largely or wholly retracted (as in Fig. 84-13a), less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S2 and S3 (body heriadiform or hoplitiform)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Parachalicodoma) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- T7 with narrow, median, apically truncate projection extending well beyond teeth of T6 carina (northern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Pseudomegachile)(in part) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin usually thickened and impunctate; head much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus usually greater than interocellar distance
- Front coxa with erect spine
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Chalicodoma) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- Anterior margin of clypeus rounded (rarely weakly emarginate medially), strongly crenulate, produced well over base of labrum, not thickened; head little developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus not greater than interocellar distance
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Pseudomegachile) (in part) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Front tibia without apical posterior angle, or, if weakly evident, then angle not covered with short hair
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Maximegachile) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin usually thickened and impunctate; head much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus usually greater than interocellar distance
- Apex of front tibia with one or usually two spines, posterior spine as found in Largella being absent; mandible not so expanded apically, outer margin not or weakly concave, narrowest part more than half as wide as apical margin
- Mandible elongate, approximately parallel-sided or narrowest preapically, and mandibular ridges smooth and shining (at 40 /H11003); posterior hypostomal area with strong tooth
- Mandible three-toothed
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Largella) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin usually thickened and impunctate; head much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus usually greater than interocellar distance
- Apex of front tibia with three spines, posterior spine less acute than others and hidden by dense, short hairs; mandible strongly expanded apically, outer margin thus concave in basal half and narrowest part little over half as wide as apical margin (Zanzibar)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Pseudomegachile) (in part) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Front tibia without apical posterior angle, or, if weakly evident, then angle not covered with short hair
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Eumegachile) (in part) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- T7 with large, exposed, biconvex, punctate surface; body chalcidomiform (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Callomegachile) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Mandible threeto seven-toothed, without especially deep emargination and with no teeth displaced basad; clypeus truncate to highly modiﬁed, but not as above.
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Eumegachile) (in part) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- T7 with large, exposed, biconvex, punctate surface; body chalcidomiform (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Chelostomoda) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- S4 largely or wholly retracted (as in Fig. 84-13a), less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S2 and S3 (body heriadiform or hoplitiform)
=====

- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- T7 with narrow, median, apically truncate projection extending well beyond teeth of T6 carina (northern Africa)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Pseudomegachile)(in part) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin usually thickened and impunctate; head much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus usually greater than interocellar distance
- Front coxa with erect spine

- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)

- Arolia absent
- Anterior margin of clypeus rounded (rarely weakly emarginate medially), strongly crenulate, produced well over base of labrum, not thickened; head little developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus not greater than interocellar distance
=====

- Front tibia without apical posterior angle, or, if weakly evident, then angle not covered with short hair

- Arolia absent

- Arolia absent

- T7 with large, exposed, biconvex, punctate surface; body chalcidomiform (palearctic)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Gronoceras) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia on outer surface with three distinct, sharp, fully exposed teeth or spines, spaces between them shining
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Heriadopsis) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia present on front and middle legs
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Chalicodoma) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- Anterior margin of clypeus rounded (rarely weakly emarginate medially), strongly crenulate, produced well over base of labrum, not thickened; head little developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus not greater than interocellar distance
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Largella) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin usually thickened and impunctate; head much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus usually greater than interocellar distance
- Apex of front tibia with three spines, posterior spine less acute than others and hidden by dense, short hairs; mandible strongly expanded apically, outer margin thus concave in basal half and narrowest part little over half as wide as apical margin (Zanzibar)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Maximegachile) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin usually thickened and impunctate; head much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus usually greater than interocellar distance
- Apex of front tibia with one or usually two spines, posterior spine as found in Largella being absent; mandible not so expanded apically, outer margin not or weakly concave, narrowest part more than half as wide as apical margin
- Mandible elongate, approximately parallel-sided or narrowest preapically, and mandibular ridges smooth and shining (at 40 /H11003); posterior hypostomal area with strong tooth
- Mandible three-toothed
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Stenomegachile) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed, less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S1 to S4; lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of apical margin of tergum
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12e, f); S6 usually with apical hairs like scopal hairs of nearby surface of sternum, sometimes with bare rim; body chalicodomiform, metasoma strongly convex, more or less parallel-sided, and commonly two or more times as wide as long (as in Fig. 84-9)
- Apex of front tibia with one or two spines, or,if (rarely) with three spines, then posterior spine a mere tubercle or covered by a patch of short hairs, or if distinct and pointed, then spaces between spines with punctures and hairs, not noticeably shining
- Arolia absent
- Anterior margin of clypeus truncate or highly modiﬁed, usually not crenulate, often not much produced over base of labrum, but if rounded and somewhat crenulate (as in some Pseudomegachile), then margin usually thickened and impunctate; head much developed posteriorly, ocelloccipital distance thus usually greater than interocellar distance
- Apex of front tibia with one or usually two spines, posterior spine as found in Largella being absent; mandible not so expanded apically, outer margin not or weakly concave, narrowest part more than half as wide as apical margin
- Mandible elongate, approximately parallel-sided or narrowest preapically, and mandibular ridges smooth and shining (at 40 /H11003); posterior hypostomal area with strong tooth
- Mandible four-toothed
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Cuspidella) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Apical margin of clypeus broadly and deeply emarginate, lower part of clypeus strongly depressed, separated from upper part by curved ridge
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Pseudomegachile) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Clypeus not or little modiﬁed, truncate, margin sometimes crenulate
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Cestella) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Mandible ﬁve-toothed, with deep, rounded emargination between third and fourth teeth, fourth and ﬁfth teeth (interpretable jointly as angularly truncate fourth tooth) connected by straight margin basal to level of ﬁrst three teeth; clypeus with large, deep, triangular, shining, hairless area in middle of which, arising from impunctate surface, is a large tubercle (Madagascar)
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Callomegachile) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Mandible threeto seven-toothed, without especially deep emargination and with no teeth displaced basad; clypeus truncate to highly modiﬁed, but not as above.
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Platysta) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Mandible ﬁve-toothed, upper two teeth close together (interpretable jointly as emarginate fourth tooth) but with small cutting edge between them, i.e., in fourth interspace, in addition to large but rather incomplete cutting edge in third interspace
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Megella) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Mandible much broadened apically, outer margin thus strongly concave; body length 18 mm or more; metasoma more than twice as long as wide
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Eutricharaea) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Mandible of ordinary shape, outer margin not strongly concave; body length much less than 18 mm; metasoma less than twice as long as wide
=====
Characteristics to the Palearctic and Oriental Subgenera M. (Amegachile) —. Mandible with third tooth pointed or rounded, fourth tooth usually rather broad, rounded or truncate, rarely acute, rarely emarginate so that mandible ﬁve-toothed;  cutting edges not crenulate ........................M. (Paracella) of Megachile (Males)(Megella is omitted because the male of the orientalspecies is unknown to me.):
- Mandible with third tooth truncate because fused to cutting edge of second interspace, fourth tooth acute; cutting edges usually crenulate (Fig. 84-11e)
=====
Characteristics to the Sub-Saharan Subgenera M. (Creightonella) of Megachile(Males)(See the long note following this key.):
- S5 (sometimes also S6) exposed and generally similar to preceding sterna (sometimes S5 largely hidden but S6 exposed); lateral extremity of carina of T6 directed basad, away from apical margin of tergum
=====
Characteristics to the Sub-Saharan Subgenera M. (Gronoceras) of Megachile(Males)(See the long note following this key.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed (less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S2 to S4); lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of posterior margin of tergum
- S8 with lateral marginal hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); metasoma commonly strongly convex and twice as long as wide or more, chalicodomiform
- Front tibia on outer surface ending distally in three bare spines or teeth, the posteriormost extended as carina along much of outer posterior margin of tibia; T6 with carina represented by long spines or long lobes, partly hidden by extremely long hairs arising before carina (Fig. 84-18)
=====
Characteristics to the Sub-Saharan Subgenera M. (Cuspidella) of Megachile(Males)(See the long note following this key.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed (less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S2 to S4); lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of posterior margin of tergum
- S8 with lateral marginal hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); metasoma commonly strongly convex and twice as long as wide or more, chalicodomiform
- Front tibia on outer surface ending in two spines or teeth (posterior tooth of Gronoceras sometimes represented by angle, which if strong is covered by short hair, see Largella); tibia usually without carina along outer posterior margin; T6 with carina variable, not represented by long spines, but if bilobed, then lobes much broader than long, surface of T6 usually without extremely long hairs, butif present, then such hairs sparse enough that carina almost always easily seen
- Carina of T6 strongly produced medially to truncate, untoothed process with longitudinal median carina (T6 with strong lateral tooth)
=====
Characteristics to the Sub-Saharan Subgenera M. (Pseudomegachile) (in part) of Megachile(Males)(See the long note following this key.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed (less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S2 to S4); lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of posterior margin of tergum
- S8 with lateral marginal hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); metasoma commonly strongly convex and twice as long as wide or more, chalicodomiform
- Front tibia on outer surface ending in two spines or teeth (posterior tooth of Gronoceras sometimes represented by angle, which if strong is covered by short hair, see Largella); tibia usually without carina along outer posterior margin; T6 with carina variable, not represented by long spines, but if bilobed, then lobes much broader than long, surface of T6 usually without extremely long hairs, butif present, then such hairs sparse enough that carina almost always easily seen
- Carina of T6 dentate or medially emarginate, not produced medially, without longitudinal median carina but sometimes with broad ridge
- T6 with carina dentate or denticulate, sometimes with median emargination but denticulate lateral to it, sometimes bilobed but margin with at least a few irregularities (Fig. 84-14a, b), rarely with median emargination forming two large teeth and an additional large lateral tooth (T6 thus four-toothed); surface of T6 above carina commonly without median depression
- Front coxa without spine or with tubercle or short spine
- T oothed margin of mandible (three-toothed) less oblique, much shorter than distance from upper tooth to mandibular base
- Eyes of ordinary size, ocellocular distance about equal to interocellar distance; T6 with strong lateral spine
=====
Characteristics to the Sub-Saharan Subgenera M. (Chalicodoma) of Megachile(Males)(See the long note following this key.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed (less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S2 to S4); lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of posterior margin of tergum
- S8 with lateral marginal hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); metasoma commonly strongly convex and twice as long as wide or more, chalicodomiform
- Front tibia on outer surface ending in two spines or teeth (posterior tooth of Gronoceras sometimes represented by angle, which if strong is covered by short hair, see Largella); tibia usually without carina along outer posterior margin; T6 with carina variable, not represented by long spines, but if bilobed, then lobes much broader than long, surface of T6 usually without extremely long hairs, butif present, then such hairs sparse enough that carina almost always easily seen
- Carina of T6 dentate or medially emarginate, not produced medially, without longitudinal median carina but sometimes with broad ridge
- T6 with carina dentate or denticulate, sometimes with median emargination but denticulate lateral to it, sometimes bilobed but margin with at least a few irregularities (Fig. 84-14a, b), rarely with median emargination forming two large teeth and an additional large lateral tooth (T6 thus four-toothed); surface of T6 above carina commonly without median depression
- Front coxa without spine or with tubercle or short spine
- T oothed margin of mandible (threeto four-toothed) strongly oblique, nearly as long as distance from upper tooth to mandibular base
=====
Characteristics to the Sub-Saharan Subgenera M. (Cestella) of Megachile(Males)(See the long note following this key.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed (less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S2 to S4); lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of posterior margin of tergum
- S8 with lateral marginal hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); metasoma commonly strongly convex and twice as long as wide or more, chalicodomiform
- Front tibia on outer surface ending in two spines or teeth (posterior tooth of Gronoceras sometimes represented by angle, which if strong is covered by short hair, see Largella); tibia usually without carina along outer posterior margin; T6 with carina variable, not represented by long spines, but if bilobed, then lobes much broader than long, surface of T6 usually without extremely long hairs, butif present, then such hairs sparse enough that carina almost always easily seen
- Carina of T6 dentate or medially emarginate, not produced medially, without longitudinal median carina but sometimes with broad ridge
- T6 with carina dentate or denticulate, sometimes with median emargination but denticulate lateral to it, sometimes bilobed but margin with at least a few irregularities (Fig. 84-14a, b), rarely with median emargination forming two large teeth and an additional large lateral tooth (T6 thus four-toothed); surface of T6 above carina commonly without median depression
- Front coxa without spine or with tubercle or short spine
- T oothed margin of mandible (three-toothed) less oblique, much shorter than distance from upper tooth to mandibular base
- Eyes unusually large, ocellocular distance thus much less than interocellar distance; T6 without lateral spine (Madagascar)
=====
Characteristics to the Sub-Saharan Subgenera M. (Pseudomegachile) (in part) of Megachile(Males)(See the long note following this key.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed (less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S2 to S4); lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of posterior margin of tergum
- S8 with lateral marginal hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); metasoma commonly strongly convex and twice as long as wide or more, chalicodomiform
- Front tibia on outer surface ending in two spines or teeth (posterior tooth of Gronoceras sometimes represented by angle, which if strong is covered by short hair, see Largella); tibia usually without carina along outer posterior margin; T6 with carina variable, not represented by long spines, but if bilobed, then lobes much broader than long, surface of T6 usually without extremely long hairs, butif present, then such hairs sparse enough that carina almost always easily seen
- Carina of T6 dentate or medially emarginate, not produced medially, without longitudinal median carina but sometimes with broad ridge
- T6 with carina dentate or denticulate, sometimes with median emargination but denticulate lateral to it, sometimes bilobed but margin with at least a few irregularities (Fig. 84-14a, b), rarely with median emargination forming two large teeth and an additional large lateral tooth (T6 thus four-toothed); surface of T6 above carina commonly without median depression
- Front coxa without spine or with tubercle or short spine
- T oothed margin of mandible (three-toothed) less oblique, much shorter than distance from upper tooth to mandibular base
- Eyes of ordinary size, ocellocular distance about equal to interocellar distance; T6 with strong lateral spine
=====
Characteristics to the Sub-Saharan Subgenera M. (Heriadopsis) of Megachile(Males)(See the long note following this key.):
- S5 and S6 retracted, variously modiﬁed (less sclerotized, less punctate, and less hairy than S2 to S4); lateral extremity of carina of T6 absent or directed toward lateral extremity of posterior margin of tergum
- S8 with lateral marginal hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); metasoma commonly strongly convex and twice as long as wide or more, chalicodomiform
- Front tibia on outer surface ending in two spines or teeth (posterior tooth of Gronoceras sometimes represented by angle, which if strong is covered by short hair, see Largella); tibia usually without carina along outer posterior margin; T6 with carina variable, not represented by long spines, but if bilobed, then lobes much broader than long, surface of T6 usually without extremely long hairs, butif present, then such hairs sparse enough that carina almost always easily seen
- Carina of T6 dentate or medially emarginate, not produced medially, without longitudinal median carina but sometimes with broad ridge
- T6 with carina bilobed (Fig. 84-14c) or sometimes simple, not at all toothed, or sometimes with small lateral tooth; surface of T6 above carina usually with median depression
- Arolia present on front and middle legs
=====
Characteristics to the Sub-Saharan Subgenera M. (Platysta) of Megachile(Males)(See the long note following this key.):
- Hairs of T6 above middle of carina not very long, not extending far beyond carina, although laterally dorsum of T6 may have very long hairs; carina of T6 commonly lower, not or weakly bilobed [in M. (Megella 15(2). Carina of T6 short, occupying little over one-ﬁfth width of tergum, high, rounded-truncate, slightly crenulate, not emarginate medially
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Creightonella) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with six teeth, incomplete cutting edges of similar shape (Fig. 84-17d) in second, third, and fourth interspaces, the last small and often inconspicuous (metasoma parallel-sided)
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Austrochile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12d-f); metasoma parallel-sided, body thus heriadiform or chalicodomiform (as in Fig. 84-9)
- S1 with large midapical spine
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Schizomegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12d-f); metasoma parallel-sided, body thus heriadiform or chalicodomiform (as in Fig. 84-9)
- S1 without apical spine
- Claws each with two teeth on underside; proboscidial fossa closed posteriorly by process from lower side of each genal area
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Rhodomegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12d-f); metasoma parallel-sided, body thus heriadiform or chalicodomiform (as in Fig. 84-9)
- S1 without apical spine
- Claws without or with but one ventral tooth each; proboscidial fossa open posteriorly
- Metasomal integument red, and T2 and T3 without deep transverse postgradular grooves; glossa broad, ligulate
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Thaumatosoma) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12d-f); metasoma parallel-sided, body thus heriadiform or chalicodomiform (as in Fig. 84-9)
- S1 without apical spine
- Claws without or with but one ventral tooth each; proboscidial fossa open posteriorly
- Metasomal integument black, or, if red, then with deep postgradular grooves; glossa linear or only slightly broadened
- Mandible bidentate; T6, as seen from above, with strong, rounded, basolateral shoulders, lateral margins thus strongly concave immediately posterior to shoulders
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Hackeriapis) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12d-f); metasoma parallel-sided, body thus heriadiform or chalicodomiform (as in Fig. 84-9)
- S1 without apical spine
- Claws without or with but one ventral tooth each; proboscidial fossa open posteriorly
- Metasomal integument black, or, if red, then with deep postgradular grooves; glossa linear or only slightly broadened
- Mandible with three or more teeth; T6 without shoulders, lateral margins gently convex to gently and rather uniformly concave
- T2 and T3 usually with deep, transverse postgradular grooves, these absent from some middle-sized and large species in which claws have strong basal tooth (except in M. semiluctuosaSmith); pubescence usually giving a gray aspect, often forming apical white tergal fasciae; fulvous pubescence often present but conﬁned to apical part of metasoma, rarely (M. ustulataSmith) metasoma with extensive fulvous pubescence
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Chalicodomoides) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12d-f); metasoma parallel-sided, body thus heriadiform or chalicodomiform (as in Fig. 84-9)
- S1 without apical spine
- Claws without or with but one ventral tooth each; proboscidial fossa open posteriorly
- Metasomal integument black, or, if red, then with deep postgradular grooves; glossa linear or only slightly broadened
- Mandible with three or more teeth; T6 without shoulders, lateral margins gently convex to gently and rather uniformly concave
- Metasomal terga without deep, transverse postgradular grooves [except in C. (Callomegachile) mcnameraeCockerell and others from New Guinea northwestward]; claws without basal teeth; pubescence black, fulvous, or with white patches, not grayish in aspect and not forming tergal fasciae; fulvous pubescence, if present, not conﬁned to apical part of metasoma
- Mandible shining (although reticulate), apical margin very oblique, as long as distance from basal tooth to base of mandible; sharp hypostomal tooth behind base of mandible
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Callomegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- Mandible without cutting edges between teeth (Fig. 84-12d-f); metasoma parallel-sided, body thus heriadiform or chalicodomiform (as in Fig. 84-9)
- S1 without apical spine
- Claws without or with but one ventral tooth each; proboscidial fossa open posteriorly
- Metasomal integument black, or, if red, then with deep postgradular grooves; glossa linear or only slightly broadened
- Mandible with three or more teeth; T6 without shoulders, lateral margins gently convex to gently and rather uniformly concave
- Metasomal terga without deep, transverse postgradular grooves [except in C. (Callomegachile) mcnameraeCockerell and others from New Guinea northwestward]; claws without basal teeth; pubescence black, fulvous, or with white patches, not grayish in aspect and not forming tergal fasciae; fulvous pubescence, if present, not conﬁned to apical part of metasoma
- Mandible dull with minute roughening, apical margin shorter; no tooth behind base of mandible
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Mitchellapis) of Megachile (Females):
- S6 with large smooth hairless area before apical fringe; T6 with many long hairs visible in proﬁle, its apex produced and shallowly emarginate; pronotal lobe with rounded transverse ridge
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Chelostomoda) of Megachile (Females):
- S6 uniformly punctate and hairy; T6 with only very short hairs visible in proﬁle, its apex rounded; pronotal lobe with strong transverse carina
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Amegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Species with fulvous and black coloration suggestive of Callomegachile; third mandibular tooth broad and irregularly truncate because of fusion with cutting edge of second interspace (Fig. 84-11e), second (in Australian area) truncate (sometimes obliquely) or sinuate at apex
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Eutricharaea) of Megachile (Females):
- Species usually dull-colored, gray, often with pale metasomal bands of hair; third mandibular tooth as well as second angulate, cutting edge in second interspace usually present although incomplete and not indistinguishably fused to third tooth
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Creightonella) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with six teeth, incomplete cutting edges of similar shape (Fig. 84-17d) in second, third, and fourth interspaces, the last small and often inconspicuous (metasoma parallel-sided)
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Austrochile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- S8 with lateral hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); body heriadiform or chalicodomiform, metasoma ordinarily twice as long as wide (Fig. 84-9)
- S1 with large midapical spine; carina of T6 very high and weakly crenulate to serrate medially, usually not emarginate, abruptly disappearing laterally so that general aspect is a large, truncate projection (Fig. 84-14d)
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Schizomegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- S8 with lateral hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); body heriadiform or chalicodomiform, metasoma ordinarily twice as long as wide (Fig. 84-9)
- S1 at most apically tuberculate; carina of T6 low (rarely even absent), not crenulate or serrate, medially slightly emarginate (except in Mitchellapis, Rhodomegachile, and a few others)
- Hind tibial spurs absent; S6 divided into two lateral sclerites by broad, median, membranous region
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Rhodomegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- S8 with lateral hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); body heriadiform or chalicodomiform, metasoma ordinarily twice as long as wide (Fig. 84-9)
- S1 at most apically tuberculate; carina of T6 low (rarely even absent), not crenulate or serrate, medially slightly emarginate (except in Mitchellapis, Rhodomegachile, and a few others)
- T wo hind tibial spurs present (only one in Thaumatosoma); S6 continuous, not divided into lateral hemisternites
- Carina of T6 variable, without median tooth
- S4 retracted, or rear margin in some cases exposed (Fig. 84-13a)
- Carina of T6 reduced to short, non-emarginate ridge or absent; metasomal integument red, without strong postgradular grooves on T2 and T3; glossa broad, ligulate
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Thaumatosoma) of Megachile (Females):
- Only one hind tibial spur; clypeus with group of coarse, quill-like bristles arising near middle; ﬂagellum exceedingly attenuate, ﬁrst segment longer than others, last two segments expanded (Fig. 84-10q)
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Hackeriapis) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- S8 with lateral hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); body heriadiform or chalicodomiform, metasoma ordinarily twice as long as wide (Fig. 84-9)
- S1 at most apically tuberculate; carina of T6 low (rarely even absent), not crenulate or serrate, medially slightly emarginate (except in Mitchellapis, Rhodomegachile, and a few others)
- T wo hind tibial spurs present (only one in Thaumatosoma); S6 continuous, not divided into lateral hemisternites
- Carina of T6 variable, without median tooth
- S4 retracted, or rear margin in some cases exposed (Fig. 84-13a)
- T2 and T3 usually with deep, transverse postgradular grooves, these absent from some middle-sized and large species in which claws have strong basal tooth (except in M. semiluctuosaSmith); pubescence usually giving a gray aspect, often forming apical white tergal fasciae; fulvous pubescence often present but conﬁned to apical part of metasoma, rarely (M. ustulataSmith) metasoma with extensive fulvous pubescence
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Chalicodomoides) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- S8 with lateral hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); body heriadiform or chalicodomiform, metasoma ordinarily twice as long as wide (Fig. 84-9)
- S1 at most apically tuberculate; carina of T6 low (rarely even absent), not crenulate or serrate, medially slightly emarginate (except in Mitchellapis, Rhodomegachile, and a few others)
- T wo hind tibial spurs present (only one in Thaumatosoma); S6 continuous, not divided into lateral hemisternites
- Carina of T6 variable, without median tooth
- S4 retracted, or rear margin in some cases exposed (Fig. 84-13a)
- Carina of T6 evident, in almost every case medially emarginate [merely an emarginate swelling, not carinate, inM. (Hackeriapis) cliffordi Rayment; a scarcely emarginate ridge in M. (H.) appositaRayment]; metasomal integument usually black, but if red, then with strong transverse postgradular grooves on T2 and T3; glossa linear, rarely somewhat broadened
- Distance between apices of ﬁrst and third mandibular teeth nearly equal to distance from third tooth to base of mandible; apex of S1 produced as a broad, nearly hairless, median, suberect ﬂap; large, robust species; metasoma without indications of pale tergal bands
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Callomegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- T2 and T3 usually without deep transverse postgradular grooves; pubescence all black or with pale or ocher areas not forming metasomal bands; posterior margin of T6 without teeth
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Mitchellapis) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- S8 with lateral hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); body heriadiform or chalicodomiform, metasoma ordinarily twice as long as wide (Fig. 84-9)
- S1 at most apically tuberculate; carina of T6 low (rarely even absent), not crenulate or serrate, medially slightly emarginate (except in Mitchellapis, Rhodomegachile, and a few others)
- T wo hind tibial spurs present (only one in Thaumatosoma); S6 continuous, not divided into lateral hemisternites
- Carina of T6, near the untoothed tergal margin, broadly rounded except for median tooth at apex of low, longitudinal median ridge
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Chelostomoda) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- S8 with lateral hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); body heriadiform or chalicodomiform, metasoma ordinarily twice as long as wide (Fig. 84-9)
- S1 at most apically tuberculate; carina of T6 low (rarely even absent), not crenulate or serrate, medially slightly emarginate (except in Mitchellapis, Rhodomegachile, and a few others)
- T wo hind tibial spurs present (only one in Thaumatosoma); S6 continuous, not divided into lateral hemisternites
- Carina of T6 variable, without median tooth
- S4 retracted, or rear margin in some cases exposed (Fig. 84-13a)
- Carina of T6 evident, in almost every case medially emarginate [merely an emarginate swelling, not carinate, inM. (Hackeriapis) cliffordi Rayment; a scarcely emarginate ridge in M. (H.) appositaRayment]; metasomal integument usually black, but if red, then with strong transverse postgradular grooves on T2 and T3; glossa linear, rarely somewhat broadened
- Distance between ﬁrst and third (or second if mandible only bidentate) mandibular teeth much less than distance from uppermost tooth to base of mandible; apex of S1 not as above; usually smaller and more slender species; metasoma usually with indications of pale tergal bands
- Region of carina of T6 swollen except at median emargination (northern Australia and northward)
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Amegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Body with fulvous-and-black pubescence suggestive of Callomegachile; apical margin of T6 with four widely separated small teeth
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Austrochile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- S8 with lateral hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); body heriadiform or chalicodomiform, metasoma ordinarily twice as long as wide (Fig. 84-9)
- S1 with large midapical spine; carina of T6 very high and weakly crenulate to serrate medially, usually not emarginate, abruptly disappearing laterally so that general aspect is a large, truncate projection (Fig. 84-14d)
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Schizomegachile) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- S8 with lateral hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); body heriadiform or chalicodomiform, metasoma ordinarily twice as long as wide (Fig. 84-9)
- S1 at most apically tuberculate; carina of T6 low (rarely even absent), not crenulate or serrate, medially slightly emarginate (except in Mitchellapis, Rhodomegachile, and a few others)
- Hind tibial spurs absent; S6 divided into two lateral sclerites by broad, median, membranous region
=====
Characteristics to the Australian and Papuan Subgenera M. (Mitchellapis) of Megachile (Females):
- Mandible with two to ﬁve teeth, cutting edges absent or in second and third interspaces only, usually of quite different shapes in the two interspaces or absent in one or the other
- S8 with lateral hairs (Fig. 84-10j, n); body heriadiform or chalicodomiform, metasoma ordinarily twice as long as wide (Fig. 84-9)
- S1 at most apically tuberculate; carina of T6 low (rarely even absent), not crenulate or serrate, medially slightly emarginate (except in Mitchellapis, Rhodomegachile, and a few others)
